results.description:
We have been invited by Black Girls Run to attend this run we are expecting 100+ Runners/Walkers in honor of Dr. Martin Luther King.


RUN DETAILS/LOGISTICS
• We will meet at Starbucks - located at 50 Court Street, Brooklyn, NY 11201 in Brooklyn Heights on the corner of Court & Joralemon Streets at 8:30 AM - to grab some coffee, water, or a quick snack, use the bathroom and, of course, take a picture! At 8:50 AM, we will walk over to the Brooklyn Bridge which is the starting point of our run. If you are running late, you can head directly over to Brooklyn Bridge and meet us there. The route for the run is:
• Walk over to the Brooklyn Bridge as a group (after we take our picture of course).
• Run across the Brooklyn Bridge from the Brooklyn side into Manhattan.
• Run across Chambers Street to the West Side Highway/Hudson River Greenway. (Chambers Street is about ½ block to your right when you exit the bridge.)
• Run up the West Side Highway/Hudson River Greenway to 59th Street.
• This route is approximately 6.2 miles (a 10K).
• You can run all or part of the route. There are opportunities along the route to stop and walk over and take the train home. (For example – if you stop at Houston Street it will be approximately 3 miles; 14th Street approximately 4 miles and; 34th Street approximately 5 miles.)

Brunch at 3 Monkeys on 54th Street
results.name: I Have a Dream 10K

results.description:
The purpose of a restorative yoga is healing. We utilize yoga postures (asana's) and breathing techniques (pranayama), to inhibit the stress response To activate the healing and repairing systems for optimal health.

For someone to heal, they must first reduce stress. Straining to keep the body in a pose is counterproductive to the healing process, because it elicits the stress response.  

Stress weakens the immune system, therefore the body's ability to repair itself or to ward off disease is stunted. In a restorative class we execute poses that open, and restore the body, still the mind, and balance the breath.

We use blankets that are folded and rolled to support and prop the body to assist the postures. The postures are held, and rested in during the class time.  Each students is asked to bring as many towels, or blankets they would like to enhance their experience in this class. The use of props to completely support the body as it rests for a period of time in a healing position is known as Restorative Yoga.

Class fee is $12

class is for one hour

blankets are available for purchase fee is $20

results.description:
My family has participated in this event for about 6 years, even though we are not a part of the school who sponsors the event. It is open to the general public. And don't let the potential cold prevent you from coming, members of the Civil Rights Movement faced odds far worse than cold weather! 

Here are the details: On Monday, January 18, Manhattan Country School eighth-graders will honor the legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. by taking to the streets of Manhattan to speak out about what they consider to be the most pressing civil rights issues of their time. The theme of this year’s march is “The Unarmed Truth,” inspired by King’s Nobel Peace Prize acceptance speech.
Now in its 28th year, the march is part of the school’s core curriculum, which includes activism, community building and sustainability beginning in preschool.

MCS families, alumni, staff, friends, supporters and the general public are invited to participate in this educational and uplifting annual event. The march, which starts at 10 a.m. at MCS’ future home at 150 W. 85th St. and ends at approximately 1 p.m. at our current building at 7 E. 96th St., will follow the route below:
1) Future Home of Manhattan Country School (150 W. 85th St.)
2) Central Park (Central Park West at West 90th Street)
3) Frederick Douglass Circle (110th Street and Central Park West/Frederick Douglass Blvd)
4) W. 125th St.
5) Harriet Tubman Statue (Saint Nicholas Avenue at West 122nd Street)
6) Islamic Cultural Center (1711 Third Avenue at East 97th Street)
7) Manhattan Country School (7 E. 96th St.)
results.name: 2016 Martin Luther King, Jr. Commemorative March

results.description:
Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.

results.description:
Compassion is the fashion, and fur is DEAD! Caring Activists Against Fur (CAAF), will be making our immutable opposition to the horrific Chinese fur trade known to those unscrupulous cretins whose livelihood is the confinement, torture and extraordinarily brutal extermination of innocent beings - all in the name of fickle "luxury" and transient, superfluous "fashion." CAAF will stage another anti-fur demo at Macy's on West 34th Street in New York City. Let's not miss this EXTRAORDINARY opportunity for us to get the message of compassion for animals trapped in the bloody fur trade out to the public!

Come and add your voice to a burgeoning group of energetic animal activists whose prime directive is to elevate public awareness about the plight of innumerable defenseless foxes, minks, raccoons, dogs and cats and other mammal victims of the gruesome Chinese fur trade, who are violently and systematically removed from their natural habitats, corralled into inescapable death camps, crammed into tiny, filthy cages for months in ALL weather conditions, beaten, stomped on, anally electrocuted, gassed, bludgeoned to death, even SKINNED ALIVE so that affluent first-world consumers can gleefully, obliviously parade around, morbidly draped in the skins that are, quite literally, ripped off these animals' backs as they helplessly writhe in overwhelming shock and agony 'til the final throes of death overtake them. For many of these unfortunate creatures, that means the agony lasts for minutes or even hours!

These helpless animals are tortured and killed in the most horrifically cruel ways imaginable - all for vain, pretentious, human notions of "luxury apparel" and "fashion." Jump into the ongoing campaign to STOP this insanity and work toward the total abolition of the global fur industry. Come out and HELP US make a vocal, public impact for the animals trapped and languishing in this insidious death trade, and to send a meaningful message to the heartless people who line their pockets with blood and entrails, who build their posh castles with the unspeakable screams of terror and suffering from countless innocent beings. For those unfamiliar with the realities of the horrible global fur trade, please take a few minutes to watch the following ( Warning: Graphic imagery!):

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ueBWi8BL0PQ

Disgusting? Horrible? Unforgivable? Agreed, so PLEASE come and help us to vocalize our extreme objection to this inexcusable, retrograde, medieval barbarism, to discourage/deter potential fur-shoppers from patronizing this retail dealer in death and torture, to enlighten the public to the grim realities behind their whimsical, self-deluding notions of fashion, and to encourage them to make more compassionate choices in shopping for winter apparel. In a world with so many great (and more economical) cruelty-free fabrics and styles, there really is ABSOLUTELY NO EXCUSE for this ongoing madness.

WHAT: ** CAAF Don't Buy Fur! demo @ Macy's on 34th St, NYC**

WHERE: Macy's Department Store, 151 West 34th Street New York, NY 10001.

WHEN: Monday, January 18th, 2016

TIME: 1 ~ 3pm

Activists are invited to gather from 1:00pm forward in front of Macy's Department Store at 151 West 34th Street. If there are any questions about directions to and from this location in Manhattan, please call Caring Activists Against Fur @[masked] or send an email to information@caafgroup.com.

We will have plenty of signs, literature and relevant props to share with interested members of the general public. All YOU need to bring is yourself and your voice to speak up for the voiceless, who cannot articulate their own wish to freely live out their lives under the sun, to frolic and to bear young, to behave in accordance with their own natures with no interference from our species.
results.name: CAAF 'Don't Buy Fur!' protest @ Macy's on 34th Street in New York City

results.description:
Here's something to do for your holiday. Join us at B&H Photo Video for one of their photography talks. 

Have you always wanted to know the secrets of professional wildlife photographers? How do they perfectly capture the colors on a hummingbird’s wing? 

What are the correct settings for a jaguar roaming in the late afternoon light? Finally, what are some ways that your wildlife photographs can help promote conserving the world’s precious wildlife? 

Renowned Argentinian nature photographer and documentary filmmaker Ossian Lindholm will cover the basic and advanced techniques of gear, specific wildlife settings and scouting wildlife locations. He will teach you how to think about composition and lighting when capturing animals in the wild.
results.name: B&H Photo talk on Wildlife and Conservation Photography

****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 1:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

RVSPs limited to 10.

You must also state if you're a foreign national (non-US citizens, permanent residents, or green card holders for ITAR purposes). This won't affect the substance of the discussions.

• http://www.meetup.com/NewSpace-NYC/events/227371245/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QXQXr6N5DC0

John Abrashkin from Honeybee will need the names of attendees, and the identity of any foreign nationals (non-US citizens, permanent residents, or green card holders) for ITAR purposes. Won't affect the substance of the discussions.

results.description: Hi everyone, so this is my first time hosting this meetup group and I look forward to making it a good one. We will be watching Rosenwald, a film about the work between Julius Rosenwald, a Jewish-American philanthropist, and the African-American community. Afterwards, we will go to a nearby cafe and discuss the film. I will let you all know about the location of the cafe closer to our meetup date. Only those people who are sure that they can come should RSVP. I look forward to seeing everyone.
results.name: Rosenwald Documentary Meetup

results.description:
45 minutes of diving into the teachings, techniques, and practice of Meditation, for new and experienced Meditators.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Let's meet up and Meditate

group.name: Meditation & Kirtan: For New and Experienced - LES/E.Village

venue.name: Helen Hayes Studios

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.
results.name: ADULT BALLET CLASS Level: Elementary

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

<a href="https://www.facebook.com/RendezVousnyc"></a>

results.description:
This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience!  Whether, you are in business or looking to create a start-up or get funding for one, this is the event for you. This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. You will find many who are open to share information about their business and are willing to build a future business relationship with you!...Better than Facebook, Twitter and Linkedin!

Remember to bring plenty of business cards.

The Lexington Lounge at The Court Hotel is in the heart of midtown, you will be able to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 

What: Interesting After Hour Networking Event
Hosts: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about, plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ACTUALLY ATTENDING. 

We look forward to see you networking with the best business professionals that New York City has to offer. We ask that you put your name and industry on the name tag that we will provide.

VOLUNTEERING: We will need extra hands. Anyone that would like to assist us with registration, please call or email me. 

SPAM: Please don't spam our members with your products/services or company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be banned from this group


Want more business from events? If you are interested in sponsoring our groups or this event, please email me or go to http://businessonashoestring.com/sponsoring.htm 


Comments from past events: 

"For all those who couldn't make it you missed a great night! Lots of great conversation and lovely people to meet Thanks to Roger for his great organisation" - Julia Meyer 

"It was a great meetup, good mix of people and made plenty of new contacts, hope to attend again" - Berni Moestafa 

"Really enjoyed talking to the people I met. Good group. Very open. Welcoming. Will definitely come again!" - Fahd Ansari

"Thank you for hosting the wonderful meet up, I made a lot of new friends over there and I believe people attended are very much enjoy the conversations and the time. I can't wait to be part of the next event!" - Wei Zheng

“One of the most valuable evenings I have experienced in a very long time!” - Rob Friedman 

“Excellent. Diverse and welcoming group of people doing interesting things in the startup world. I look forward to future events” - Amanda

“Great group! Very interesting and diverse start-up biz people, a lot to learn from each other. Very positive experience - looking forward to upcoming events and lectures.” - A D 

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.” - Bill Katz 

"I got a new client, plus I really enjoyed meeting many of you. Thank you!" -Thomas Kant 

============================== 
This event is organized by Roger Kuperways 

Our family of small business groups have over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing! http://www.businessonashoestring.com

============================== 
Join our business group on Facebook Our main parent website is http://www.businessonashoestring.com
==============================

results.description:
This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will experience!  Whether, you are in business or looking to create a start-up or get funding for one, this is the event for you. This FREE event brings together entrepreneurs, decision-makers and investors to network and build new business relationships in a great venue. You will find many who are open to share information about their business and are willing to build a future business relationship with you!...Better than Facebook, Twitter and Linkedin!

Remember to bring plenty of business cards.

The Lexington Lounge at The Court Hotel in the heart of midtown, you will be able to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 

What: Interesting After Hour Networking Event
Host: Roger
Why: Establish new contacts and/or reconnect with old ones.
Cost: FREE admission
Atmosphere: The dress code is business casual. 

Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

THIS IS A MULTI GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ACTUALLY ATTENDING.

*** RETAILERS ONLY***

Four of the biggest personalities in retail, on one stage, at a venue with great NYC views! All in walking distance from the convention center. 

This event is free to retailers and space is limited.  

With growth expected in virtually every market and increased revenues projected globally, what does the battlefield look like today and what will tomorrow bring? Join our expert panel as we dive deep into the new world of commerce.

Topics:


• Phygital

• Flat world opportunities

• The Importance of Emotion in New Retail

• Amazon – The rise and rise.. a freak or friend?

• Agile – Talk or true?

Moderator:

Paul Greenberg (The Forum for International Retail Association Executives)

Panel:  


Nadia Shouraboura founder & CEO hointer.com

Howard Saunders  Retail Futurist, 22and5.com

Gary Wheelhouse Chief Digital Officer, Harvey Norman


45 minute fireside panel, Q&A & networking with international retailers.

results.description:
After many requests, I am thrilled to finally announce a weekly study group of A Course in Miracles in Westchester!

A Course in Miracles is a guide to personal and spiritual transformation. It is based on the belief that we have two thoughts systems, one based on fear and separation from the Divine and another one based on love and oneness with the Divine. The Course is designed to help us become increasingly aware of the LOVE that is already present within us to let go all of the fearful thoughts and beliefs that we hold. Students of all levels are welcome. We will start with chapter I and we will study a few of the early lessons in the Workbook. Class is free, but suggested donation is $10 since both Lyna and Café 72 are lovingly donating the time and space. ABSOLUTELY no outside food or drink are allowed. We hope to see you on Monday to experience miraculous shifts from fear to love!
results.name: A Course in Miracles Weekly Study Group

results.description:
Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

results.description:
Happy New Year and sorry for the late notice, WSSL'ers! If you've never shot with us before, you have one week to register and the range background check takes 5-7 days, so please read the entire description below and register right away if you would like to join us this month! We love new shooters, so come check us out and learn to shoot!


Have you always wanted to learn how to handle a firearm but didn't know where to start? Or do you have some (or a lot) of experience with guns but don't know where to shoot in the city? Then come join us for WSSL's monthly .22 rifle shoot!  Learn safe and responsible shooting skills with a group of fun and friendly ladies at the Westside Rifle and Pistol Range on January 18th. 


If you want to shoot with WSSL this January and you've never joined us before, please read the entire event description and start your registration process with Westside ASAP! 


Feel free to bring friends! (Remind them to register in advance!) All levels are welcome (never shot, beginners, intermediate, advanced). We will have some fun shooting drills, too! This meetup is limited to women, but we do have  co-ed shoots sporadically throughout the year, so keep posted!

Register here at least five days in advance: here: http://www.westsidepistolrange.com/registration.php?referral=WSSL&glemail=rsvp@nycwssl.org 

You will receive a "transaction ID" by e-mail from the Range. Please bring this with you and a photo ID.

Price: $35 (plus tax) to the range. You can pay the range after the event: cash, check or charge. This fee includes classroom safety instruction, private instruction on the firing line, rental of a .22 rifle, one box of ammo (additional ammo is available from WSSL while supplies last; please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo) and eye/ear protection. We also ask that you please donate $5 (or whatever you feel like donating) to WSSL directly to help cover our operating costs like our website fees, locker rental at the range, etc.

Come at 6:15 PM for the club business meeting and help us plan activities -- we have some great excursions in mind -- or join us from 6:30 PM - 8:30 PM for the shooting.

FIRST TIME SHOOTERS (First time shooting with us/Westside):

When you arrive at the Range on WSSL night pick up your brown ID card at the office. (Bring your transaction ID in case your brown ID card has not been prepared.) You will sign in using the Range ID number on your brown ID card every time you attend WSSL. 
You will also need to bring other ID with you to check in on WSSL night. 

RETURNING SHOOTERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
Use the Range ID number on your brown card to sign in when you arrive on WSSL night. 


WESTSIDE RANGE MEMBERS:

E-mail Lauren Silberman at [masked] so that she can give the Range an accurate count. 
On WSSL night sign in using your Range membership number. Range members do not pay the $35 WSSL fee, and WSSL will provide ammo while supplies last (please make a small donation to cover the cost of this ammo). 

ALL SHOOTERS:

If you've registered, but find that you can't attend, please e-mail Lauren at [masked] As soon as poosible so we have an accurate headcount for the Range. 
If you have to cancel at the last minute please call the Range directly at [masked] or [masked]-9448.
results.how_to_find_us: The range is downstairs. Just walk right in and ask for WSSL! See you there!
results.name: January .22 Rifle Shoot at Westside Range

results.description:
If one of your new year's resolution is to try something new, then join us for our next Tipsy Paint Meetup!

Why just paint when you can Tipsy Paint? That's what we thought too! So put a brush in one hand and a drink in the other, and join us for a unique, colorful way to spend the night out and make new friends!

Tipsy Painting is a step-by-step, group-oriented painting instruction, which is designed to simultaneously entertain and enlighten our members. A professional artist guides you through a featured painting that is yours to keep and proudly display at the end of the night. And don’t worry — no experience is necessary. 

PREPAY ONLY (MUST PURCHASE IN ADVANCE $39-$45)

GET TICKET HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Jan-18-2016_at_0630PM

*Price goes up to $45 as the event date gets closer. We recommend getting tickets ASAP to save $ and guarantee your spot. This event will sell out, especially for women. Tickets will not be sold at the door.  

What's included: 

• 2+ hour course lead by an expert artist to teach you the art of mixing colors, blending and painting techniques. 

• 12x16 pre-sketched canvas, acrylic paint (water based), and all painting supplies (brushes, aprons, easels) supplied

• Drink & Food Specials (1 drink min, can be non-alcoholic)  

 • Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• Free Raffle & Prizes 

Get Tickets At This Link (no door sales) -  

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Jan-18-2016_at_0630PM

Can I still attend If I don't know how to paint? Yes, no experience is necessary. 

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own.

venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath. 

This 90 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program.  We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program. 

When: Mondays 6:30pm-7:45pm.  Please arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

No fees for Newbees

Repeater fee-$10(Cash only)
results.name: Breathe, Meditate, Rejuvenate

group.name: "Art of Living" NYC- Making Life a Celebration

results.description:
As a CEO, Tami brings the same Lean and Agile practices from her product management days to the way her whole company works. She'll discuss how the fundamentals of Lean and Agile apply throughout the company, and how as a UX Designer, you can encourage other teams support your experimental ways and get executive involved.


About the Speaker: 

Tami Reiss is the CEO of Cyrus Innovation.

Agenda:

6:30 to 7:00pm - Space opens, Meet & Greet.

7:00 - 8:30 - Presentation and Discussion.

UPDATE: We will be working on Swing Out, the signature move of Lindy Hop!  Drop ins are welcome.  Although the beginner class is sold out, this class is still open!!  Come join the fun!  (In addition to RSVP here, there are a few more students who signed up at QED)


**************************

If you are familiar with 6 count moves using triple steps as well as 8 count moves such as Swing Out and Charleston, you are welcome to join our Advanced Beginner class from 6:30 to 7:10 on Mondays (January 11, 18, 25, Feb. 1).  We consider this more like a group private lesson, and we teach whatever students may need.  You will have lots of feedback from your instructors, and it is a great way to grow as a dancer.  


Although drop ins are welcome, we highly recommend to attend all 4 classes.  Besides, there is a big discount by signing up for the whole month so please take advantage of it! 

Classes are taught by Akemi Kinukawa and Andrew Kontola, very experienced and friendly instructors of Swing Dance Astoria (www.Facebook.com/swingdanceastoria). Space is limited and only advance purchase will guarantee your spot! Register here: http://qedastoria.com/collections/michael-duke-akemi-kinukawa

Looking forward to dancing with you!

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

    facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Course Description:

Fullstack Academy's Introduction to Front-End Development is an in-depth 10 week course covering the fundamentals of front-end web development. Taught by experienced Fullstack Academy Instructors, the class will dive deep into client-side development, covering everything from HTML5, CSS3, Intermediate JavaScript, jQuery, Responsive Design, MVC Frameworks, and more. Modelled after Fullstack Academy's renowned Software Engineering Immersive, the Introduction to Front-End course is structured in a lecture-workshop format, with each concept taught solidified through practical application.

Who is this Course For?

Introduction to Front-End Development is designed for beginner programmers. It's well suited for:

Marketers
Product/Project Managers
Designers
Other Professionals seeking to add a technical skill-set to their resume
Non-Technical Entrepreneurs
Beginners getting started on the path to becoming a software developer
Anyone interested in breaking into the world of coding Course Dates & Times:

Course Dates: January 18, 2016 - March 24, 2016 (10 Weeks)

Schedule: Monday & Wednesday Evenings | 6:45PM – 9:45PM

What is the Curriculum?

Introduction to Front-End Development covers a variety of development concepts, technologies, and tools. Building a functional, responsive front-end involves many components, so the curriculum spans several areas over the course of 10 intense weeks. Topics include:

HTML5
CSS3
JavaScript Fundamentals
JavaScript Practical Components
Document Object Model (DOM)
Bootstrap
jQuery
Object Oriented Programming (OOP)
Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)
Data Interchange Formats (JSON & AJAX)
Back-End Integration
Introduction to Model-View-Controller Architectural Patterns (MVC) 

What is the Tuition?

Tuition for this course is $3,650. An initial deposit of $250 is required to reserve your spot in the course. The remainder of the tuition is paid on the first day of class.

What do I need to bring?

Students must bring a functioning laptop to class. Macs are preferred; Windows machines are acceptable. You will also need to complete roughly 10 hours of pre-work before the first day of class.

Where can I find more details?

More details on Fullstack Academy and the Introduction to Front-End Development course can be found here: http://www.fullstackacademy.com/part-time/front-end-development

Interested students must register using the link below -- space is limited!
https://introduction-to-front-end-development.eventbrite.com
results.name: Introduction to Front-End Development

results.description:
Join us for our weekly figure drawing session at The National Arts Club.

This session is open to all levels. Open to the public.

<a>Let us know you're coming.</a> 


We operate on a first come first served basis. Arriving by 6:45 is a good way to guarantee a seat.

• Bring your own drawing supplies.


• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break.

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp!

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes.

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there.

Simon

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships

 

 


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships

and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.
results.name: Healing the Loss of a Love - Attracting a Healthy and Loving Relationship

results.description:
• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing powers 
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships 
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions 
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities 
• Develop new resources and capabilities 
• Become clear about your life’s purpose 
Develop your intuition by tapping into the innate intelligence that resides within your body and mind 
Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us. 
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs. 
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses 
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life. 
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you. 
Discover the passion and power that resides within you 
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind 
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies. 
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.


Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
Some of us hackers and friends are reading through a Shakespeare play the third Monday evening of every month. We started with Lear on November 28th, 2013, and, in what has become a tradition, sent out for pizza between Acts III and IV. So arrive with a copy of the play of the month (or some device that will allow you to access it online), your stentorian voice, some spare change for a slice, a couple of bucks for beer, and join the culture wars.

Our schedule includes a list of the plays we have not yet read and when we expect to read them. Thanks to Jesse Lansner for suggesting the remaining schedule.

Coming up over the next few months:

February 2016    Romeo and Juliet 
March 2016        The Comedy of Errors
April 2016           Taming of the Shrew
May 2016            Othello
results.name: Shakespeare Night: Winter's Tale

results.description:
Hi ladies,

Due to countless request, over and over again lol,  I've decided that we are going to Dubai!!!I found this amazing and completely escorted tour package for us. Here is what is included:

*Round trip flights New York-Dubai, Dubai-New York

*Airline taxes & fuel surcharges

*5 nights Dubai at a 4 star hotel (Hyatt Place Dubai/Al Rigga)

*Dubai tourism fee 

*Hotel porterage

*All transfers

*7 meals: 5 breakfasts, 2 dinners

*Sightseeing per itinerary in modern air-conditioned motor coach

*Services of English-speaking tour manager per itinerary

*Entrance fees per itinerary

*Comfortable wireless earphones for enhanced touring

Special Features 

Dubai City Tour

Abu Dhabi City Tour

Traditional Show Dinner Cruise

Burj Khalifa

The cost of the trip is $2054 (for a double) and I have arranged a payment plan for us. (Please note that all payment are nonrefundable unless trip is cancelled. If it is, you will receive a full refund)Please note that this price is for early booking and the price will go up after June 15th so please get your deposits in before then to guarantee this rate!

April 15th  - $500 Deposit (non refundable)

May 15th -$222.00

June 15th - $222.00

July 15th - $222.00

August 15th - $222.00

September  15th - $222.00

October 15th - $222.00

November 15th - $222.00 (final payment)

*a single is $[masked]

*Optional Travel insurance $150

*Payments can be made via paypal ([masked]) or in person

Here is the full itinerary:

DAY 1, Monday - Depart for the United Arab Emirates

DAY 2, Tuesday - Arrive in Dubai

Arrive in Dubai, the quintessential land of opulence, wealth and astonishing skyscrapers that stand alongside ancient mosques. Take the rest of the day to rest, relax and acclimate to the adrenaline-charged tempo of this city and your new time zone 

Overnight: Dubai

DAY 3, Wednesday - Dubai City

A fabulous day discovering one of the world's most futuristic cities with its dramatic skyline, once a tranquil port of Bedouin traders and pearl divers. Begin at Dubai Creek, cutting through the heart of the city and winding its way from the trading port of the Gulf to the Ras al Khor bird sanctuary on the desert edge of the city. Drive via the Jumeirah Mosque with its unique architecture and the Dubai Marina with amazing views of man-made Palm Island, the artificial archipelago in the Persian Gulf. Continue past Dubai's signature landmark, Burj Al-Arab, the celebrated sail-shaped hotel facing the Arabian Gulf. Then, ascend to the very top of Burj Khalifa, the tallest building in the world; view the unequaled panoramic vistas of the entire city, ocean and desert. At the iconic Atlantis the Palm Hotel, you'll be surrounded by the astonishing aquarium inhabited by thousands of marine species from around the world. On to the Dubai Museum, housed in the Al Fahidi Fort, a realistic example of a desert fort, complete with cannons and battlements. End the day at the Dubai World Trade Center, with its lively alleys of gold souks, unlike anything you've ever witnessed. Time on your own before tonight's Welcome Dinner with your fellow travelers and Tour Manager 

Overnight: Dubai 

Meals: Breakfast, Dinner

DAY 4, Thursday - Abu Dhabi City Tour

Today, an excursion to Abu Dhabi, ultra-sophisticated capital of the United Arab Emirates, often called the "Arabian Jewel". Drive past Jebel Ali, the largest man-made port in the world before arriving at the magnificent Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque, iconic symbol of Abu Dhabi. Continue along the city's glamorous Corniche, with blue waters glittering on one side and shimmering skyscrapers lining the other. At the Breakwater, pause to take photos of the city's fabulous skyline. Then, on to Heritage Village, a reconstructed traditional "oasis". Here, we journey to the past and experience life in Abu Dhabi before oil revenues altered the landscape. Many different aspects of desert life are attractively displayed in the open-air museum along with workshops where craftsmen demonstrate traditional skills while women sit weaving and spinning. After lunch on your own, visit Zayed House for a fascinating peek into the life of the late Sheikh Zayed, "Father of the Nation". Return to Dubai via Yas Island, where the Ferrari World theme park and brand-new Formula I race track is located. Tonight, a very special evening as we depart the Dubai Marina aboard a traditional Dhow sailing ship. Cruise along the shoreline of the Persian Gulf with beautiful views of the city's skyline and enjoy a delectable International Buffet Dinner and entertainment on board 

Overnight: Dubai 

Meals: Breakfast, Dinner

DAY 5, Friday - Full Day in Dubai

Take a leisurely stroll along Dubai's vast coastline this morning or head to the colossal Dubai Mall for shopping and perhaps indoor skiing on the vast slopes. Or, join the thrilling optional Desert Safari this afternoon. Board a 4X4 vehicle in Dubai and head out towards the highest sand dunes of the surreal surrounding desert. Feel the thrill of "dune bashing" as you spiral up and down the enormous golden dunes. Stop to watch the beautiful sunset before reaching the Bedouin Campsite. You'll be welcomed with traditional Arabic coffee and might have the opportunity to ride a camel. Then, enjoy a specially prepared Barbecue Dinner, prepared on an open fire. Later, a captivating belly dancer enchants you with her swirling dances under the starlit sky before returning to Dubai 

Optional: Half Day Desert Safari (PM) 

Overnight: Dubai 

Meals: Breakfast

DAY 6, Saturday - Full Day in Dubai

Morning and afternoon at leisure for further exploration of this vibrant city. Or, participate in the optional tour to Sharjah, cultural center of the Emirates, known for its major museums, distinctive landmarks and elegant mosques. Visit the Islamic Museum, housing over 5000 artifacts from all over the Islamic World and the Heritage Museum depicting Sharjah's rich and diverse heritage. Time to stroll in the unique covered souk and bargain to your heart's content for jewelry, handicrafts, and carpets before returning to Dubai 

Optional: Half Day Sharjah Tour (AM) 

Overnight: Dubai 

Meals: Breakfast

DAY 7, Sunday - Depart the United Arab EmiratesTransfer to the airport for your departure flight 

Meals: Breakfast

**Please note that this is not a private tour just for us. We will be on the tour with a lot of other people from all over the world (which is pretty cool too). Also, on all our trips I ask that no matter what we do during the day (hanging out together or separately) that each night we all have dinner together. That way we can re group and discuss how our day went. After that we can either choose to do an after dinner activity (for some reason we always seem to end up in somebody's club lol) or call it an early night. 

Also this trip is open to anyone over the age of 16, so please feel free to invite your friends, significant others, etc. If you do not have a roommate, I'll pair you up with someone :) I hope you all can make it!

Please visit www.justusgirlfriendsny.com/faq/ for answers to frequently asked questions regarding our trips.

xoxo

Sam

Instagram @justusgfsny

https://www.facebook.com/groups/justusgirlfriendsny/

www.justusgirlfriendsny.com

results.description:
Add some variety to your running -- do some speed work on the track! Think you're slow? This is the best way to get faster. Nobody is too slow to try a track workout. This is how you will improve.

We encourage runners of all ability levels to join. You are not too slow! If you are a even a little bit intimidated by the thought of running laps at the track we want to challenge you to come join us and find out just how awesome it actually is. You will feel great (and exhausted) at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!


The East River Park Track is just across the FDR highway at the end of 6th street. Just walk across the pedestrian overpass and the track will be right there.


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. We pile all our stuff together and are (relatively) nearby for the duration of the workout. We have never had a problem with theft, but that doesn't mean it won't happen.


After the workout join us for beer at ABC Beer Co. at Ave C between 6th and 7th.

results.description:
The Gong works on all levels, from the physical to the mental-emotional and spiritual to heal and transform. The almost tangible to the touch sound waves of the Gong can promote immediate and great positive change in the listener. 

These sessions start with very light stretches and pranayam-breathing exercises at the beginning and may include some meditation or chanting a mantra. The sounds and vibrations of the gong create deep relaxation and state of meditation by altering brain waves from a Beta (waking state) to Theta & Delta (deep meditation). Science teaches that during these brain frequencies we access our deeper subconscious and superconscious and they are key states for healing.
Many people have noticeable experiences during a Gong Bath. People can feel their bodies twitch (as the energy meridians are cleared & balanced), have insights, bursts of creative ideas, see splashes of color behind their closed eyes, out of body experiences, or simply experience feelings of total peace & connectedness.

Gong sound can be used to rebalance the physical, emotional and spiritual bodies. It has a profound affect on our cardiovascular, endocrine and immune systems. It is an excellent therapy for stress related issues, depression, fatigue, anger and hostility, feelings of separation, loneliness, and fear along with many other conditions related to lack of balance and harmony in the body.
results.name: Sound Healing-Gong Bath Meditation

results.description:
Join Marcos Salazar, career + life coach and Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change on Monday, January 18th for a FREE workshop on Personal Branding with Purpose: Communicate Your Passions, Talents, and Impact for Career Success (learn more about Marcos here).

====================================== 

** OFFICIAL RSVP on Eventbrite. Register: http://bit.ly/BSCpbJan18**

=======================================

Developing a personal brand - creating your image and guiding your reputation - has never been more important. Whether you’re seeking to move up in your organization, looking for a new job, thinking about making a career change, launching a new business, wanting to attract new clients, or looking to scale your social impact, in today’s rapidly-changing, hyper competitive working world a strong and consistent personal brand is key to creating new opportunities for your career or business.

The truth is we all have a personal brand. It is how we are perceived by others - our friends, colleagues, and the public. It is what people think about when they hear our name and what people say about when we are not in the room. The key question we need to ask is: do we take charge of our personal brand or do we leave it up to chance?

Personal Branding with Purpose is not about learning how to "create" a personal brand. It's about learning how to live your personal brand by sharing your authentic self and communicating clearly the value you can provide others. Our passions, talents, and impact are unique gifts we can give to the world. By learning how to market these gifts through personal branding, you create not only career and business opportunities but also a greater capacity to make a difference in the lives of others and the planet.

* Doors open at 6:45 PM, workshop starts at 7:00 PM sharp *

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN 

• An understanding of personal branding- how you can leverage it to create new career and business opportunities as well as scale your impact

• Gain greater clarity about your passions, values, purpose, and career goals that serve as a foundation for an authentic personal brand

• Define your Big Idea - what you stand for - and integrate it with your unique knowledge and experience to communicate your brand value

• Identify your niche, target audience and articulate how you can help solve problems they have

• Assess and strategically build your online identity and presence|Develop strategies for maintaining and adapting your personal brand in a world of constant change

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR 

• Professionals looking to create new career and business opportunities

• People seeking a new job or looking to make a career shift

• Entrepreneurs wanting to increase their own visibility to grow their businesses

• Creatives and service providers (consultants, coaches, agents, and speakers) wanting to attract new clients and business opportunities

• Students or recent grads looking to build a foundation for their future career path

INSTRUCTOR BIO


Marcos Salazar (@marcossalazar) is a social entrepreneur, career + life coach, consultant, speaker, and community builder. His passion is working with professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives to help them pursue work they are passionate about, build authentic personal brands, become financially successful, and create lives that make the world a better place. He does this through 1-on-1 coaching, nonprofit and businesses consulting, and on a larger scale as Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change where he’s built the largest social impact community and professional development hub in New York City. Marcos earned a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College as well as a Masters in Organizational Management and an Executive Leadership Coaching certificate from The George Washington University. Marcos is a board member of the Young Professionals Nonprofit Network and an American Express Leadership Academy Fellow. You can learn more about him at www.MarcosSalazar.com.  


SPACE PARTNER 

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/KPL4uynCqIoMu2deyfpUIP59J1-rk9uZwr8AQMeHBdGbJTw9YsL_JSkKxTZucHnuclxQsW120aO4HFk4uK8rilV2ZxPHbeyg-sLyxfzjQdMmcjLV-29EequKqpboQGQlLg

The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

results.description:
If you're like the average DSA member, you can't help but make politics a topic of conversation. However, depending on the situation, this is not always welcome, intelligent or productive. So DSA is here to provide such a forum and we can mull over the latest debate with a bit of structured discussion, facilitated by a member of the steering committee. This event is especially good for people who didn't make it to the watch party event! Some topics we'll be going over...

What were Bernie Sander's highest and lowest points in the debate?

What were the toughest questions of the night and how did you like the candidates' responses?

On a related note, what would the democratic socialist response be to those questions? Don't worry if you've never read Michael Harrington. All knowledge levels are welcome to our meetings and apart of being in DSA is coming up with the solutions together!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
THE LOCATION FOR THIS EVENT IS IN A DIFFERENT OFFICE BUILDING BUT STILL IN THE FINANCIAL DISTRICT. SECURITY IS TIGHT, SO PLEASE RSVP AND I CAN SUBMIT YOUR NAME TO THE DESK!!! WHEN YOU ARRIVE, LOOK FOR "MEDIAMATH" AND GET CHECKED IN. WHEN YOU GO TO THE 45TH FLOOR A DSA MEMBER WILL MEET YOU AT THE RECEPTION DESK.

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 4,000 words or 15 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 4 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there,

Dan

347 - 743 - 1854
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description: ARCsquared  stands for American Red Cross Amateur Radio Club. We are located at the Northern New Jersey headquarters of the New Jersey Chapter of the American Red Cross, and our "Base station", Call sign NJ2RC, is located in the Disaster Operations Center ("DOC"). It is a project that was started in 2005 by ARC volunteers to improve the ARC's ability to communicate during disaster and emergency operations. It is not a corporation or other legal entity.  It is a group of hams interested in assisting The American Red Cross.  Hams are urged to become official Red Cross volunteers. Members are interested in emergency communications using amateur (Ham) radio, and are (or aspire to be) licensed by the FCC as Ham radio operators.
