results.description:
Prepayment@ http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5964 is required

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment is required http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5964 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5964

results.description:
Our sister meetup group, Third Wave Fashion, is hosting a panel featuring founders from the New York Fashion Tech Lab Accelerator program. We will be recording on site with our Fashion Is Your Business podcast tream! The details of their event:
---

REGISTER HERE TO ATTEND THIS EVENT

Oh heyyyyyyy, we're baaaaaack! It's our first *official* meetup in forever–and we've got a whole slew of great events lined up for you this year. So much is happening! We're kicking off with a bang–you've heard about the New York Fashion Tech Lab, and now you get to meet them in person. So much wisdom to be had.


MEET THE NEW YORK FASHION TECH LAB ::

The Lab is in it's third year, and has helped launch and grow some fantastic startups. Come meet some of the founders–and learn more about the NYC fashion tech eco-system! In their words: The New York Fashion Tech Lab is a twelve week program that provides a selected group of early & growth stage fashion technology companies with unprecedented access to New York’s leading fashion retailers and brands fostering iteration, validation, and acceleration of technologies that advance the industry. The program was co founded, in 2014, by the Partnership Fund for New York City and is powered by Springboard Enterprises.


More details below....


PANELISTS :: Karen Moon // CEO + Cofounder of Trendalytics – Merchandise intelligence revealed. Empowering creative organizations with vital information to reach their full potential. Jade Hng // CEO + Cofounder of StyleSage – Fashion meets big data. Manage your brand. Work smarter. Increase sales. Amanda Curtis // CEO + Cofounder of Nineteenth Amendment – Independent designer presales. Designed globally, launched weekly, made to order in the USA.


REGISTER HERE TO ATTEND THIS EVENT

EVENT DETAILS ::

Tuesday, January 19th,[masked]:30 pm - 8:30 pm Panel from 7-8 pm, networking, drinks, & snacks before + after. $20 and space is pretty limited, so be sure to RSVP quickly.


LOCATION ::

Our new partners at AlleyNYC will be hosting us in their Midtown location: 500 7th Avenue, 17th floor–at 37th Street.

FASHION IS YOUR BUSINESS :: To add to the fun, we've partnered with OS Fashion, and we'll be live recording the panel–to become a special edition of the popular Fashion Is Your Business podcast. So excited to see you all again, you awesome peeps!

xo

Liza & the Third Wave Team
results.name: Meet the founders from the New York Fashion Tech Lab

results.description:
Class Tuesday night 6:30-8:30pm.
Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.
Everyone is welcome!
results.name: Intercambio - Spanish/English language exchange

results.description:
The Art of Connection: How to kick social anxiety, meet new people and make people care about your ideas.

Join us for this interactive presentation with professional speaker & social entrepreneur, Andrew Horn. Andrew is the Founder of www.Tribute.co and a captivating speaker who will empower you with simple techniques to meet new people, speak with confidence and article the value of your business. 

Andrew will share:

1. The difference between networking and connecting

2. The 3 best questions to spark meaningful conversations

3. Simple steps to be present, engaging and comfortable in conversation

4. Explain what you do in 60 seconds or less with the “did you know” technique

5. Tell your businesses signature story to win buy-in

6. Why you shouldn't be "nice" to investors

7. How to send the perfect email intro

Space is limited. 

About the presenter:

Andrew Horn is the Founder & CEO of Tribute: “The Most Meaningful Gift on Earth”, making it easy to build a collaborative video montage of a group of people celebrating someone you care about.

results.name: The Art of Connection: How to kick social anxiety, meet new people ..

Don't miss our first Bowling Meetup of the year!

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1Q7Ynw2

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1XL4I4W

Mix & mingle before bowling with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

Next the fun begins.  A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Then a member of the male team will bowl a frame. The process continues until all 10 frames are bowled. The group that has the highest score of each game wins a prize!

At end of game, ladies will stay at the same lane. Male team will rotate to next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address. 

What's included:

• Free Bowling Games, Shoe Rental & Scorecard Matching 

• Snacks & Ice Breakers

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Grey Goose Drink Specials 

• Prizes for winning team

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1Q7Ynw2

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1XL4I4W

Prepay Only Event - No tickets sold at door 

Can I still attend even If I don't want to bowl?  Yes, you can still be a member of the team and mingle.  Food & Drink will also be available for purchase. 

Can I come alone?  Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +30?  This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  About 40 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+.

results.description:
While a strong majority of Americans openly claim to “believe in equal rights for women”, most do not consider themselves feminists! According to a poll conducted in March 2015, the proportion of Americans who openly consider themselves feminists might be as small as 18%! Indeed, despite 85% of poll respondents declaring their belief in "equality for women"…

… 52% said they were not feminist,

… 26% were not sure,

…  4% refused to answer the question.

What’s more, even post-definition (i.e. after having been “told to think of ‘feminist’ as defined as “someone who believes in the social, political and economic equality of the sexes”), still 40% of US adults – including half of all men – reject thinking of themselves as feminists! 

When considering that:

• This is a global phenomenon with, across the world, more people who view ‘feminist’ as a negative term than a positive one, or even actually as an insult (as suggested by 19% of poll respondents in Britain);

• Last year, ‘feminist’ even entered a list of “words to ban”;

• Even prominent speakers are being advised not to use the word ‘Feminism’ and/or to “tone down” their activism, e.g. Emma Watson for her “HeForShe” speech at the U.N. in 2014;

• Celebrities and role models in the spotlight seem confused about the actual meaning of Feminism and the history of the doctrine/movement – some even ignorantly conflating it with other movements and philosophies (e.g. Humanism, Egalitarianism, etc.) on a regular basis, creating a ripple effect, which only adds to the global confusion, negative stigma and taboo…

… All of this then begs the questions: why, how, since when, … did Feminism get such a “bad rep” and become a “dirty word”?!

*****

Suggested agenda for the meetup:

1.  Let’s address these questions together, tackling the many ways the word is mishandled or misinterpreted, the baggage currently associated with the term.

2.  With recent reports indicating the current extent of gender inequality across the world and the fact that reaching gender equality will likely take us some more decades or even yet another entire century, if we continue at the current rate, let’s discuss the progress Feminism still has to accomplish before we can collectively claim to live in a blissful post-feminist world!

3.  Let’s also tackle the complex issue of what we could possibly do / ought to do about Feminism’s “brand problem” in the meantime…
results.name: THE ‘F- WORD’!

results.description:
This is an open time to work on your own projects, with the help of mentors available. You can bring you programming-related questions and get help from developers with experience in specific subject areas.

Each month we'll be focusing on a different area of JavaScript and front-end technologies.

Who: 

All skill levels are welcome! 

We recommend this event for experienced JavaScript engineers who want to learn new skills. (There are better forums for learning JS for the first time.)


Bring / Prepare: 

Your own laptop. Come with questions or projects you need help with or just come and code.


What to expect: 

For this event, we will have mentors volunteering to help you with React specific questions. That said, you're welcome to come with any type of engineering project and we'll do our best to help.


Even if you don't have a specific question in mind, feel free to come and code in an inviting environment.  

We're structuring this based on the Hacker Hours format described here: http://hackerhours.org/

Agenda:

6:30 - 6:45: Mingle, drinks (including beer!), and food

6:45 - 7:00: Quick overview of the format for the evening

7:00 - 8:30: Questions, answers, and hacking!


Mentors:

- Christopher Lee

- Henry Dotson

- Chris Henrick

- Tom

- Otto

+ You! Let us know if you want to volunteer as a mentor!!! 

We're open to mentors of all levels. Email [masked] to sign up to mentor at this or future events.

Host:

The Alley is generously offering space. 

We're happy to be hosting this meetup at our new home in Alley's Chelsea community. You can learn more about the Alley community here.

Sponsor:

Clutch Talent is providing food & drinks.

The Clutch Talent team is based in the Alley. Clutch provides white glove services to engineers in their job searches. They also engage in volunteer activities to grow and support the engineering community.

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = 

NY JavaScript expects all speakers and attendees to follow the JSConf Code of Conduct.

Due to limited seating, RSVPs for our events are $3-15. There are no refunds or transfers. Proceeds go to ScriptEd, a charity to increase code literacy among NYC youth at under-resourced schools.

If you would like to sponsor or speak at one of our events, please email us at [masked].

results.name: JS Hacking & Help Night: React.js

results.description:
Oh heyyyyyyy, we're baaaaaack! It's our first *official* meetup in forever–and we've got a whole slew of great events lined up for you this year. So much is happening! 


We're kicking off with a bang–you've heard about the New York Fashion Tech Lab, and now you get to meet them in person. So much wisdom to be had. 

MEET THE NEW YORK FASHION TECH LAB ::

The Lab is in it's third year, and has helped launch and grow some fantastic startups. Come meet some of the founders–and learn more about the NYC fashion tech eco-system! 

In their words: The New York Fashion Tech Lab is a  twelve week program that provides a selected group of early & growth stage fashion technology companies with unprecedented access to New York’s leading fashion retailers and brands fostering iteration, validation, and acceleration of technologies that advance the industry. The program was co founded, in 2014,  by the Partnership Fund for New York City and is powered by Springboard Enterprises. 

More details below.... 

PANELISTS :: 


Karen Moon // CEO + Cofounder of Trendalytics – Merchandise intelligence revealed. Empowering creative organizations with vital information to reach their full potential. 

Jade Hng // CEO + Cofounder of StyleSage – Fashion meets big data. Manage your brand. Work smarter. Increase sales. 

Amanda Curtis // CEO + Cofounder of Nineteenth Amendment – Independent designer presales. Designed globally, launched weekly, made to order in the USA. 

EVENT DETAILS ::

Tuesday, January 19th, 2016 

6:30 pm - 8:30 pm 

Panel from 7-8 pm, networking, drinks, & snacks before + after. 

$20 and space is pretty limited, so be sure to RSVP quickly. 

LOCATION ::

Our new partners at AlleyNYC will be hosting us in their Midtown location: 500 7th Avenue, 17th floor–at 37th Street.

FASHION IS YOUR BUSINESS ::  

To add to the fun, we've partnered with OS Fashion, and we'll be live recording the panel–to become a special edition of the popular Fashion Is Your Business podcast. 

So excited to see you all again, you awesome peeps!

xo

Liza & the Third Wave Team
results.how_to_find_us: AlleyNYC Midtown Coworking space – at 37th Street
results.name: NYC // Meet the founders from the New York Fashion Tech Lab

results.description:
Cybersecurity - managing threats from internal and external cyber attacks - is one of the most complex challenges facing large businesses. How do they actually do it?


For this event, we're fortunate to have Gary Bond introduce the systems used by large organizations to manage cyberattacks. Gary will describe the coordination issues involved in tracking down attacks across tens of thousands of systems and the current cutting-edge in the responses (and responsiveness) required.

About the speaker:

Gary Bond was most recently a consultant and program manager for JPMorgan Chase's Cybersecurity initiative. He has provided project and program leadership for global initiatives at UBS, Credit Suisse, IBM, D&B, Lehman, Marsh & McLennan, Microsoft, EMC, United Technologies, Barclays and many others. He specializes in the application of technology disruption to both change ingrained corporate behavior and deliver $100m+ budget projects on time. 

Gary is one of the leading authorities on large scale, advanced technology transformation. Don't miss him!

This event will be located at:

ThoughtWorks

99 Madison Avenue, 15th Floor

New York, NY 10016
results.name: Cybersecurity at Scale

results.description:
Prepayment@ http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5964 is required

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment </a> is required <a href="http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5964">http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5964 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

results.description:
2015 is a big year for spatial in Lucene/Solr! This presentation will review the new features in 2015. The features to be covered will at least include the following: Heatmaps: Solr can generate gridded facet counts, and fast. See a live demo; PackedQuadPrefixTree: A more compact and efficient alternative to QuadPrefixTree; FlexPrefixTree: A configurable spatial tree to balance index size with search speed; RptWithGeometrySpatialField: An RPT index paired with serialized geometry with an in-memory cache allows indexed shapes to be searched accurately and quickly; Geo3D: Polygons and other shapes computed on the surface of a sphere or ellipsoid. It’s also very fast when point data is pre-converted to 3 dimensions; GeoPointField: A leaner alternative to RPT; BKDTree / BKDPointField: An experimental Lucene codec for spatial data. It’s very efficient; RPT spatial indexes for non-point data are 40% leaner; find out how/why; Solr spatial ease-of-use improvements, to include distance units, a nicer Solr query parser, and GeoJSON format.

Bio:
David Smiley is a well recognized Apache Lucene/Solr expert. He wrote the first book on Solr, he's a Lucene/Solr committer and PMC member that improves Lucene and Solr, he speaks at conferences about it, he does training, and he offers part time independent consulting services / development. Much of Lucene's spatial module was developed by David.
results.name: Lucene/Solr Spatial in 2015

results.description:
Important: this meeting is in a different room than the ones we're usually in!


Building Xamarin Android apps with Azure Mobile Services offers a complete end-to-end platform for implementing mobile apps. While the Android platform offers some inherent security protections, developers are on the hook for implementing security within their applications. This presentation will focus on using Android and .NET APIs for building secure apps written in C#. We will first take a look at the architecture and security model for Android. We will examine how to securely store data on a device, how to communicate securely, and how to implement cryptographic solutions. Strategies for authenticating and authorizing users with Azure Mobile Services will be demonstrated to protect access to your application and data. Third party security libraries will be discussed, along with example implementations. The goal of this presentation is to leave developers with a set of security controls that they can build into their own applications without reinventing the wheel.

Speaker

Jack is an Application Security Expert with over a decade of experience building, breaking, and securing complex systems. Jack is Co-Founder and CEO of nVisium, while also leading research and development initiatives. With experience developing in Java, Objective-C, and C#, Jack performs risk assessments and penetration tests for Fortune 500 companies and government agencies. He is an active Android security researcher with a keen interest in large-scale security analysis.


Pizza will be provided courtesy of Xamarin
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor: Broadway room
results.name: Building Secure Android Apps With Xamarin

Class Tuesday night 6:30-8 pm.
Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.
Everyone is welcome!

WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't allow latecomers to enter.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

results.description:
Join Licensed Soul Therapist Carolyn Goldfarb for a three hour gathering of women exploring how to connect to your true authentic expression. The benefits are astounding! Sharing your core truth and living your purpose is deeply pleasurable and incredibly satisfying. Most women are blocked from accessing her core power, her true awareness of self. Soul Therapy is an evolutionary embodiment of exploring your humanness from the SOUL level.

During our time together you will be asked five questions that will lead you into greater awareness of who you are, why you get stuck, what your soul wants to communicate to you, how to manifest your dreams and how to love yourself. If you have ever wanted to tap into your unlimited potentiality and be happy in the flow of life with less stress, now is the time to do so.

Your soul is the guardian and gatekeeper to your true self. Your authentic voice is the one main requirement that resides within you and provides ample opportunities for you to listen, grow and expand. Most people don’t know how to listen or understand how to embrace your soul’s wisdom and knowledge. Soul Therapy Seminars are designed to show you how to remove the barriers that stop you from experiencing and loving a fully expressed, evolutionary life!

Carolyn Goldfarb will support and guide you along the way.

http://www.soultherapyschool.com/carolyn

results.description:
VidMob //  Founder Alex Collmer & Strategist Jerry Bell

VidMob creates seamless ways for people with abandoned media assets to connect and transact with people from around the world who know how to edit video. Their goal is to build the simplest way possible for anyone to take their existing media, and make it better.

NYC Film Co-Op // Founder Joseph Pearce

The NYC Film Co-Op members get together to help one another make films, web series and documentaries. Pitches are made, crews are formed, and the filmmaking process starts!

Dynamite // Co-Founder & COO Larry Lieberman

Dynamite! lets you create 42 second videos edited together from segments you record. Each segment can have a different video face mask and/or audio filter. So be yourself, or wear a mask, it’s a totally new way to create personal videos and share them with your friends, or the world.

Critical Mention // Director of Marketing Dane Wiseman

Critical Mention allows users to search global TV, Radio, Online News & Social Media, watch video, edit and share coverage, receive real-time email alerts, build reports, and analyze coverage through word clouds and graphs.

CareTV // Co-Founder Max Austen

A television channel with customized content for people with dementia, delivered over Internet into their homes.


**Event Details:

Location : 1100 Avenue of the Americas

Time: Tuesday January 19th, 2015

6:30-7:00 PM Networking

7:00-8:00 PM Presentations

8:00-8:15 PM Networking

NY Video Meetup Sponsors:  HBO, Waywire.com & Kaltura!

*Food and drinks will be provided*

Hey everyone, 2016 is here and so is our next meetup. Eventsy and The M/E/T are kicking-off 2016 with a special "POWER NETWORKING, POWER PITCHING" seminar at the recently opened WeWork Penn Station space! 

You consider yourself a creative type...or an entrepreneur...or your own brand. Trouble is, you don't know how to pitch yourself to a studio, an investor, or an agency. The same old, same old...doesn't seem to work. Don't just trade business cards and LinkedIn connections; learn how to tell your story in a quick & compelling manner.

Come refine your old networking techniques with a trained expert (well-known for his work with creative-focused entities like the Writers Guild of America and New York University, among others.)

Members of The M/E/T can attend this one for FREE!!! But you must first subscribe to to The M/E/T Facebook group then use the promo code "MET15" at http://www.eventsy.com/…/eventsy-goes-to-the-met-new-year-…/

And of course, the usual free beer, courtesy of our wonderful WeWork Penn Station hosts! Special thanks to Kenneth Ong with M/E/T for inviting the NYFG to participate in this exciting event. 

We look foward to seeing you there!

TJ Collins

NYFG Co- Founder

This will be a 4 mile run or so through the streets of Rutherford.  If you want a completely flat run, this run's not for you as there are gradual uphills and downhills throughout the run.


****Please wear reflective clothing, a vest, or some kind of light.  It is important that we are clearly visible to vehicles on our route regardless of which route we choose.  Thank you.****

IF YOU'RE NOT GOING TO MAKE IT, PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP PRIOR TO THE EVENT.  IF IT'S VERY COLD OUTSIDE IT'S LESS LIKELY THAT WE'LL WAIT FOR YOUR ARRIVAL.


Here is a route pretty indicative of a dark, winter route:

We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a few minutes past 6:30 PM to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.  Looking forward to seeing you.

results.description:
This week I am going to see The Forest I will arrive at 8:00 for the 8:20 pm showing. I  have seats D6 and 7 If you are coming post your seat #  Since this is such a late show I plan to go to The Broad Street Diner at 6:45 for the $10 dinner special. If you plan to join me for dinner please post so I can have them save us enough seats.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!   Love, Cassie

Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

If you purchase tickets online and can’t make it to the theater, just respond to the email address you receive the confirmation email from ([masked]) and they can refund the payment remotely.

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Fri/Sat) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket unless you buy a gift card at the theater and pre-load it 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to drive there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

Hope to see YOU at the movies!!    Love, Cassie

PS: I am doing this with my friendship group too so if you are S&L do wear your wristbands. These are loads of fun at the movies they glow in the dark!

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

results.name: $10 dinner and $5.50 Movie Night- The Forest

results.description:
Dear Friends,

The Heart Sutra workshop topic will be on Emptiness, Self/Ego, and Buddha Nature. During our previous workshops, we've had lots of fun with our discussions.  At times we were going around and around, but we had a great time discussing and trying to understand.    If you did not join us for before, no worries, there are still tons to talk about and learn.

There is no cost to this workshop.  If you want to donate you can donate to your charity of choice or Venerable GuoXing's center.

Venerable Guo Xing will be doing a teaching-workshop where we can discuss and exchange ideas.  We will be learning and discussing the  Emptiness, Self/Ego, and Buddha Nature from the Heart Sutra. 

The Heart Sutra (Mahaprajnaparamita-hridaya-sutra) is one of the shortest and best known sutras.  It focuses on the Buddha's teachings in the purest, clearest and most concise essence.  http://www.meetup.com/DharmaDrink/pages/The_Heart_Sutra/

Many of you have come to dinner and have met Venerable Guo Xing, so you know that this will be a great opportunity to learn from him in this setting.

---------------

Venerable Guo Xing is the current Abbot of Chan Meditation Center in Queens NY and Dharma Drum Retreat Center in Upstate NY, part of Dharma Drum Mountain (Chan/Zen), an international Buddhist organization based in Taiwan. Venerable was ordained under Chan Master Shen Yen in 1986 and assisted the Master between 1987 and 2007 in leading meditation retreats in Taiwan, Southeast Asia, and the United States, totaling more than 50 retreats, including the first 49 day retreat at DDRC in 2000.  Venerable is one of Chan Master Sheng Yen’s Dharma heirs. 

_/|\_

Eddie

results.name: Dharma Workshop on Heart Sutra - Venerable Guo Xing

results.description:
A prompt is a writing exercise with a specific theme and a time limit. These small exercises get writers to move away from their comfort zone and try a new genre, voice or character. Inspiration can be drawn from unlikely places and time limits lead to creativity.

results.description:
Dear Dharma Drink Friends,

The Heart Sutra workshop topic will be on Emptiness, Self/Ego, and Buddha Nature. During our previous workshops, we've had lots of fun with our discussions.  At times we were going around and around, but we had a great time discussing and trying to understand.    If you did not join us for before, no worries, there are still tons to talk about and learn.

There is no cost to this workshop.  If you want to donate you can donate to your charity of choice or Venerable GuoXing's center.

------------

Venerable Guo Xing will be doing a teaching-workshop where we can discuss and exchange ideas.  We will be learning and discussing the  Emptiness, Self/Ego, and Buddha Nature from the Heart Sutra.


The Heart Sutra (Mahaprajnaparamita-hridaya-sutra) is one of the shortest and best known sutras.  It focuses on the Buddha's teachings in the purest, clearest and most concise essence.   http://www.meetup.com/DharmaDrink/pages/The_Heart_Sutra/

Many of you have come to dinner and have met Venerable Guo Xing, so you know that this will be a great opportunity to learn from him in this setting.

Venerable Guo Xing is the current Abbot of Chan Meditation Center in Queens NY and Dharma Drum Retreat Center in Upstate NY, part of Dharma Drum Mountain (Chan/Zen), an international Buddhist organization based in Taiwan. Venerable was ordained under Chan Master Shen Yen in 1986 and assisted the Master between 1987 and 2007 in leading meditation retreats in Taiwan, Southeast Asia, and the United States, totaling more than 50 retreats, including the first 49 day retreat at DDRC in 2000.  Venerable is one of Chan Master Sheng Yen’s Dharma heirs.

_/|\_

Eddie

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your NEW YEAR with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
You've heard if all: five(+?) thousand years, yin and yang and the all-magical Chi, Confucius the master teacher, and of course we invented EVERYTHING!


That just tells you Chinese have a sense of humor to boot. We're not always serious, inward-looking, or even modest. So let's look at some of the things my students bring up a lot when they experience culture shock at their first contact: etiquette and unspoken rules, fun facts, language blunders. Bring your own story too!

We'll learn a few useful expressions for your new Chinese experience.

Please prepare: A Chinese expression.

Kat has a system of learning spoken Mandarin that aims at better retention by more implicit learning. Come ready to talk! :D

*Chinese Workshop lessons are conducted in English and Mandarin. Each workshop is a stand-alone lesson/practice, and not intended for native speakers of Chinese. Thanks for your understanding. :) 这个 workshop 旨在学习中文，不适合母语为中文的朋友，请见谅！:) 

*There's a $10 event fee to go toward the Meetup Organizer subscription charge as well as the 2-hr lesson. Thanks! 

*You can check out our past Workshops outside the U.S. at: http://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Workshop-Europe/

Hope to meet you then!

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
With all of the exciting news about HoloLens, the real question is…"How do I get started?"  Well, the amazing thing is that the development process is the same as developing a Windows 10 application.  Because Windows 10 core runs across tons of devices (tablets, desktops, phones, IOT, Xbox, and HoloLenses), developing for one is the same as the other, with some specific tweaks.  So, if you are interested in learning what your starting point is for moving forwards towards HoloLens development, come learn about what's new with Windows 10, the environment, project setup, and tricks and tips along the way.

James Quick graduated from Vanderbilt University with a major in Computer Science and Spanish.  Upon graduation, he joined Microsoft as the Technical Evangelist in South Florida and then continued on to New York City.  During his time at Microsoft, he was worked with various community groups, organizations, and schools, providing professional development training for high school teachers and college professors, leading numerous talks and workshops in the community, and speaking at local events such as ITPalooza, South Florida Code Camp, and Boston and New York Code Camps.  He enjoys focusing on Cross Platform Mobile Application Development and Cloud while dabbling in 2D Game Development.

results.name: So You Want to Develop for HoloLens??

results.description:
Elizabeth Freedman will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment!

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance!

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up.

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.name: English Country Dance with Elizabeth Freedman!

results.description:
John Wagner will lead a discussion on the legal & political issues in the great state of New York that may be of special interest to skeptics. These may include NY laws related to, among others:

- The right to die
- Vaccination requirements
- Withholding medical care for religious reasons
- Using tax money to support religious schools
- The regulation of oral suction during circumcision
- GENDA and LGBT issues in state law
- New York’s Office of Faith-Based Services
- Tax exemptions granted to religious institutions,

As Chair of the Secular Coalition for NY, John Wagner works to bring a secular viewpoint to NY’s legislative process He tries to represent the views of non-religious, humanist, atheist, and skeptical NYers. He will lead the discussion and solicit you opinion on these and other issues that may be of interest to the group. He will share what he knows about these issues and the barriers that prevent NYers from enjoying a more rational, well-reasoned legal system. He will also try to share the opportunities that exist for change.

John Wagner is a Professor of Neuroscience, Developmental Biology and Genetics at Weill-Cornell Medical College in NYC. He has been a freethinker and humanist since he was a teenager. He is also a member of the NYC Skeptics, The Secular Humanist Society of NY, The American Humanist Association, the International Humanist and Ethical Union, the NYC Atheists, American Atheists, Gotham Atheists, The Freedom From Religion Foundation, The Iowa Atheists & Freethinkers, The Council for Secular Humanism, and Center for Inquiry-NY. He represents the International Humanist and Ethical Union at the United Nations, where he is active in the Committee for Freedom of Religion or Belief.

NOTE: We ask that, as a courtesy, members who RSVP and decide later not to attend please change their RSVPs to no at least 48 hours before the event.

LIVE STREAM FROM SILICON VALLEY.  PLEASE REGISTER ON THIS MEETUP SITE AND YOU WILL BE SENT INSTRUCTIONS TO GET THE LINK.

Access Silicon Valley and Women’s Startup Lab invite you to join us on January 19, 2016, for an INCREDIBLY special evening with ANN MIURA-KO, a partner at FLOODGATE, one of Silicon Valley’s hottest, most sought, after early stage investors.

Ann (the self-described "investing ninja assassin"), together with her FLOODGATE co-founding partner, Mike Maples, were early investors  in companies that you may have heard of-- Twitter, Lyft, Twitch, Chegg, reputation.com, Task Rabbit,  Weebly, Wenelo and many others.  Ann has been called “one of the most powerful women in startups” by Forbes magazine.

In this interactive, audience led discussion, Ann will discuss topics of burning interest to startup entrepreneurs.

PROGRAM AGENDA:


7:00 PM – 8:30 PM CALIFORNIA TIME: Discussion with Ann

ABOUT ANN

Apart from her role as partner at FLOODGATE, Ann is a lecturer in entrepreneurship at Stanford. The child of a rocket scientist at NASA, Ann is a Palo Alto native and has been steeped in technology startups from when she was a teenager. Prior to co-founding FLOODGATE, she worked at Charles River Ventures and McKinsey and Company.

Some of Ann's investments include Lyft, Ayasdi, Xamarin, Refinery29, Chloe and Isabel, Maker Media, Wanelo, TaskRabbit, and Modcloth.


Ann is known for her debate skills (she placed first in the National Tournament of Champions and second in the State of California in high school) and was part of a five-person team at Yale that competed in the Robocup Competition in Paris, France.  Ann has a BS from Yale University (EE) and a PhD from Stanford University (Math Modeling of Computer Security.)

FLOODGATE backs the most important digital businesses of the future, before traditional VCs are ready to invest.  FLOODGATE has invested in some of the most meaningful companies in business technology and consumer technology, with a combined market value exceeding $30 Billion.

EVENT ORGANIZERS:

PREMIER SPONSOR:

Procopio - Ranked among the 2014 and 2015 Best Law Firms by U.S. News & World Report

results.description:
For the January 2016 StoryCode NYC Forum we are thrilled to welcome Rachel Hulin who will present her work and her most recent project Hey Harry Hey Matilda.

The project tells the story of Harry and Matilda Goodman, 30-something twins from New England. The narrative follows their correspondence as they fumble through adulthood and their romantic feelings for one another. It is told via single-photo posts on Instagram. The first "instagram novel" has received coverage in Wired, The Washington Post, TIME, and The Wall Street Journal. And beyond that...it's beautiful.

ABOUT RACHEL HULIN


Rachel Hulin is a photographer and writer.

Her photographs have been shown at Jen Bekman Gallery, The Bronx Museum of the Arts, Wallspace Gallery, The New York Photo Festival, and ClampArt Gallery, by which she is represented.


Hulin worked as a photo editor in New York for many years; titles included Rolling Stone, Radar Magazine, and Nerve.com. Her personal essays and art writing have appeared in The Daily Beast, Huffington Post, PDN, and The Photography Post, which she co-founded. She has lectured about her own work, professional practices, and about the role of social media in photography at ICP, SVA, Parsons, Brown University, RISD, and MIAD.

Hulin's Editorial clients include Martha Stewart Living Magazine, The New York Times, The New Republic, and Real Simple.

She has a BA from Brown University and an MA from NYU.


Rachel's Flying Henry series is a children’s book of the same name, released by PowerHouse Books in 2013.

Her new project, a novel, is called Hey Harry Hey Matilda.
results.name: Rachel Hulin presents "Hey Harry Hey Matilda" - An Instagram Novel

results.description: It's a new year and we all know that means it's time to hit the gym strong with hard work and serious intentions! Let's make 2016 a big year with killer auditions and leading roles! Of course our gym supports any kind of intention as well... We welcome actors as well as writers, directors and other preformers to come work out in the style and traddition they choose along side other members that act as support, audience and/or scene partners . Members take turns presenting and recieve positive critique from others. All levels of experience are welcome from polished proffesional to those who would like to act for fun. Bring in a scene, monologue, audition sides, class project or anything else you'd like to see read/preformed dramatically. We split the studio ($5) and enjoy a great work space from our Opera Diva Yeoryia! Can't wait to see our crew back in action as well as some new members!!
results.how_to_find_us: Studio Aida, 4th Flour
results.name: First Gym After New Years!!!

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on 72nd transverse at the point that overlooks Bethesda Fountain
results.name: Central Park Training Run

group.name: Namaste Bookshop & Healing Center Meetup Group NYC

results.description:
We will continue the class and continue what we started, learning new songs on the spot, getting some pointers on style, musicianship, and the voice itself. 

I'll bring music for everyone and you can get in a lot of singing while you help or be helped by the person next to you. There will be some exercises as well and we'll do a bit of harmony. 

Bring your $7 and your good spirits. I look forward to seeing you all. Michael
results.how_to_find_us: It'll be room 16a this time.
results.name: Eighth Class in the New Series

results.description:
We're once again joining up with one of NYC's largest singles companies for their biggest event! Snag your very own hero at this singles soiree which gathers the city's hottest FIREMEN & EMT at one of NYC's hottest places! 

This event is open to WOMEN of ALL professions.   

But only open to men from legitimate Fire or EMS service including: FDNY, NYC 911 Voluntary Hospital, any Area Municipal, Private or Volunteer Organization.  

All MEN MUST show your agencies photo ID Card indicating title of "Firefighter," "EMT," or "Paramedic" at the door to be admitted (no exceptions). 

Everyone must purchase a ticket in advance to attend.

Prepay Only Event. First 5 group members save $5 by using code "HOT" at checkout ($20)  Get tickets at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/fireman/dates/Jan-19-2016_at_0700PM

What to expect:

• Complimentary Appetizers (7-8pm) 

• Firemen/EMT Drink Free Beer, Wine & Well Drinks (7-8pm) 

• Drink Specials 

• Fireman Trivia Ice breaker For Prizes 

• Professional Photography

• Hottest Fireman Contest

•  Great Music Played At Conversational Level

results.description:
The official WordPress REST API promises to revolutionize the way the world uses Wordpress – in fact, it’s already begun. At this meetup we will provide an overview of web APIs and why they are important, then demo how to install the WP API and access your content with it. We will look at a basic Javascript to-do list powered by WordPress and how to write custom API hooks to format data for it. We will briefly look over the horizon at what’s next for the API and discuss how you can use it in your own projects.


PRESENTED BY: Ty Fujimura

OPENING PRESENTATION: Creating Plugins and Themes for the Chinese Market

The presentation will provide insights on how local players use different business models compared to the West to support their operation in which the West is attempting to adapt rapidly. The presentation will also cover some cultural differences to help understand the gap in between the East and the West and better understand how the communication is nuanced.


PRESENTED BY: David Kang

ABOUT THE SPEAKERS:

Ty Fujimura is a web designer/developer and the founder of Cantilever, a boutique studio based in Ridgewood, NJ. Cantilever has designed and developed for a wide range of clients, always seeking to create digital products that embody “digital hospitality”.

David Kang started his first entrepreneurial business in commercial trading since his 2nd year in college and joined his first successful IT startup right after graduation. He is overlooking the N.Y. office for New Digital Noise (NDN) marketing agency that has its origin in Hong Kong.
results.how_to_find_us: Across the street from Port Authority
results.name: Building websites with the WordPress REST API

PLEASE RSVP ON MEETUP THEN CLICK HERE TO REGISTER ON EVENTBRITE

You are invited to Start 2016 off right at the most creative, fun, exciting, vision board event! Create the plan for a successful 2016, get helpful information from our expert speaker, Visionary Strategist and Heart Connector Stephanie Morris who will lead a 45 minute workshop on “Your Heart, Your Vision...Connecting to Your Best Life.”

Video from 2010 (See the 2015 follow up video below).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=1&v=zZkAN-JhQSM

• Learn what a Vision Board “Heart PrintTM” is and why it is a powerful tool to help you clarify your passions, goals and desires.

• Create your personalized Heart PrintTM to take home with you.

• Action steps to start manifesting your Heart PrintTM.

What you need to bring:  


• An open mind, your passions, dreams and desires. 

• Two or three of your favorite magazines that you are willing to cut up (we'll also have an abundance of magazines available).

With your donation of $15 you will receive:

2016 is the year to move away from what you don’t want and figure out WHAT YOU DO WANT!

Video from early 2015.

*** Meeting room is on the SECOND FLOOR, accessible through the Wine shop on the first floor ***

Hello!  Welcome to NYC Video Editors Cooperative.

On January 19th we'll have a discussion about what we'd like to accomplish as a group.  I started this MeetUp to develop the elements of a professional organization with purpose and structure that will benefit full-time video editors.

I'll kick off the meeting at 7:15 with a 10 minute chat - an introduction about who I am, my goals for a group like this, and (to make it interesting) some relevant work experience and industry info I can share that may be of use to attendees.  After that we'll open it up and generate some ideas about how to move forward.

All levels of professional experience are welcome to attend. 

Thank you,

TJ Daly

results.description:
Note: This is a paid event. RSVP here for $5 off.

Sending cold emails is the quickest way to grow any agency or startup that sells to businesses. However, sending cold emails can be tedious.

In this event, Alex Berman - Chief Marketing Sumo at InspireBeats, will go over what they learned sending over 1,000,000 cold emails in the last year and how you can use it to grow your company.

Takeaways include: 
* What makes the perfect subject line? 
* How much personalization is necessary? 
* Where are the best places to find leads?

You'll learn the best process for sourcing quality leads, personalizing email outreach, and all the mistakes that people tend to make in early stage sales.

RSVP on eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/what-we-learned-sending-one-million-cold-emails-selling-for-saas-startups-tickets-20262285040
results.name: Selling For SaaS Startups: What We Learned Sending One Million Cold Emails

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Bitly

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!
results.name: Tuesday Office Hours

results.description:
If you want to jump start your writing or you need a break from the novel you're working on, come join us. Just bring your own writing devices, I will provide prompts (if you have something you're working on you can work on that instead) and we'll write for 10 minutes straight. This is full- out, non-stop writing. Then we share- only if you want to- and do it again. We usually do this 2 times a meeting. It's a great way to get some words on the page. No prior reading or experience required to attend. You can leave early as we usually do this every half hour. Gotham Writer's Workshop charges $25 for this. Cost of this meetup? Free.

Jessica

<a>[masked]</a>

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.
results.name: Just Write!

Hi all!

If you would like to watch The Danish Girl with other Book Club members, please join us 7pm on Tuesday 1/19 at Regal 14 Union Square. The movie begins at 7:20pm. The address of the theater is 850 Broadway - 13th St and Broadway, 10003.

NOTE: We changed the date of this Meetup from 1/20 to 1/19 because Regal informed us yesterday that they're not screening the movie on that day at that time because of a special screening.

On Fandango, the theatre is listed as REGAL UNION SQUARE STADIUM 14. I have been assured that tickets will be available to purchase via Fandango by 1/13. This time, I will NOT be purchasing tickets ahead of time for the group. Please purchase your own ticket.

Jessie

results.description:
We had an AWESOME meetup last week on the relationship between artificial intelligence and medical diagnosis - we're taking the conversation further this week.

The focus will be on creating a centralized database of anonymized medical records along with a potential on-demand diagnostic marketplace for patients without access to immediate medical care and with greater ability to share proper diagnostic information online.

We'll be sending out a few resources ahead of time to bring new participants up to speed-  looking forward to pushing this idea forward!

results.description:
For those who attend meet ups a lot, we will be charging a $50 Monthly fee and you can attend all the meet ups you like, we will Definitely have every Tuesday & Thursdays 7-8:30PM & Fridays 8-930 PM Weekend slots will Vary & Monday, & Wednesdays  will be added once we get more members attending. NO CONTRACT NO REGISTRATION pay the months you attend! unlimited soccer $50 (First 20 people to sign up only)

Want to play soccer, burn some energy? Release some stress? Play the sport you LOVE? Then come join us at SOCCER R US Indoor soccer facility, catering services to all you soccer players! COED PICK UP SOCCER. Come experience an awesome YEAR ROUND Indoor soccer facility in Brooklyn NEW YORK. Prospect Park train station on the Q OR B Train or S shuttle. Buses close by are the B41, 43, 16, 48 &  49


Indoor Soccer Facility with Real Turf Right by Prospect Park (Elevator available for bike riders)

FUTSAL In the Morning Before Work, During Lunch and Late Evenings

MUST RSVP ONLINE

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time Vary So stay Tuned and look out for the time slots that suit you best

Real Turf, Please wear flats. 2 flights upstairs from entrance door or take elevator to 3rd floor

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING 

We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 

Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

results.description:
This past year has seen the rise in the interest in the "Internet of Things" (or IoT) and networked, "smart" objects. On this panel developers who work on hardware or at the intersection of hardware and software discuss the basics of developing for the Internet of Things. Panelists will cover how writing code for hardware is and is not different than writing web applications, how a developer can get started with hardware, and what are some of the unique challenges and opportunities the Internet of Things offers developers. 

Developers from Keen Home, Human Condition Global, and Meural,  who are innovating in the IoT space will talk about their products and the challenges they are solving in order to create smart objects.
results.name: Developing for the Internet of Things

Join us for our weekly Boardgaming Meetup.

We're a friendly group of gamers that play everything from Carcassonne & Ticket to Ride to Zombicide & heavier Eurogames! Everyone is welcome - all ages (must be over 21) but must be young at heart!

results.description: Penina Rybak MA/CCC-SLP, TSHH is an educational technology consultant, pediatric speech-language pathologist, Autism specialist, iPad Evangelist, speaker, writer, authorpreneur, and woman entrepreneur in the Digital Age. She is a purpose driven, creative educator and thought leader who believes that we are all leaders in the making and agents of change. That's why she launched her Socially Speaking™ consulting company in 2010, which provided educational conferences around North America, her Socially Speaking™ iPad App in 2012, which connected parents and service providers in the Autism community in a whole new way, and published her insightful startup guidebook with Maven House Press in 2014. "The NICE Reboot: A Guide to Becoming a Better Female Entrepreneur" is all about the Socially Speaking™ mission; balancing humanity and technology in practical and long lasting ways. So is her new book, "Autism Intervention in the iEra: Pairing Toys and Tech in Treatment", which is a comprehensive blueprint for Penina's Socially Speaking™ Social Skills Curriculum for children with Autism/special needs. Penina is a pioneer in personal growth and professional development for the iEra. Learn more about her work by finding her on LinkedIn, in The Huffington Post, The Friendship Circle Blog of MI, on Facebook: Socially Speaking LLC, on Google+: The NICE Initiative for Female Entrepreneurship, and on Twitter: @PopGoesPenina. You can also find her on Amazon: http://amzn.to/1dAWirU.

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
How often do we take the time to slow down, tune in to what our body needs, massage and stretch our muscles?

We live in a culture that values always being in action, either at our computer or at the gym (or even the yoga studio!).

But taking the time to stretch is just as important, both for its physical benefits as well as its psychological, emotional and spiritual ones.

It improves our range of motion, while also stretching our range of emotion.

- Release tightness and tension from your muscles
- Improve flexibility and circulation
- Relieve lower back pain
- Stress relief
- Deeper breathing, which leads to feelings of spaciousness and well-being
- Reconnecting with the body, leaving us feeling more whole, aware and capable of dealing with life's challenges
- Release 'happy' hormones
- Connect with the senses, sensuality and release shame around our body

We will start with a guided meditation, followed by deep breathing and slow stretching.

Please bring a yoga mat, a pen and journal, and dress comfortably.

See you on the mat!

Love always,

Melody

Sensual Meditative Stretching: Release Stress and Befriend Your Body

Tuesdays January 19, Feb 2 and 9 from 7-8:30 pm

Location TBA

New York, NY

$15 donation / $20 for 2 if you bring a friend

Register

NOTE: in order to cover costs, this meetup requires at least 5 people to be signed up 24 hrs prior for it to happen. Please RSVP mindfully and purchase your ticket so I know what size room to book for us in advance.

----------------------------
ABOUT MELODY KIERSZ
Melody Kiersz holds a degree in Happiness from the prestigious New York University, is a Certified Holistic Health Counselor graduated from the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, a member of the American Association of Drugless Practitioners, and a Certified Yoga Teacher through Jungle Yoga Ashram.

Melody is a deep listener and reads between the lines to guide you in discovering the ways you're holding yourself back from your true expression. She specializes in healing our relationship with our bodies, our selves and others, improving body image and self-esteem, increasing our ability to speak up, share, and allow ourselves to be seen and loved as we are. As the Founder of Naked Wellness, her goal is to guide you as you peel all those layers of resistance so you can turn yourself on for a life full of health, passion, power, freedom, joy and pleasure.

Based in New York City, Melody offers in-person and long-distance private sessions, and is really passionate about everyone really getting that they are absolutely perfect exactly as they are.

Find out more at nakedwellness.com

results.description:
Change the Constitution - or DESTROY the Constitution?

There are two ways to modify the U.S. Constitution - by amendment or Constitutional Convention. 

The amendment method has been used successfully 27 times, however, a Constitutional Convention, or a "con-con," has NEVER been used since the Constitution was ratified, and perhaps with good reason.   

Once set in motion can a con-con be stopped or controlled?  Is there a mechanism to ensure a representative selection of delegates at a con-con, do not lead to a runaway convention and put the Constitution into the hands of those who want to radically change it - or destroy it altogether? 

John F. McManus describes the deception and the dangers and discusses the latest attempts to launch a con-con. 

BEWARE OF ARTICLE V


Understanding the dangers of a Con-Con 

A presentation by John F. McManus, the author of numerous books and articles and serves as publisher of the New American magazine and President Emeritus of The John Birch Society. His clearly written and spoken words have helped many Americans to understand and combat our nation's self-defeating policies. 

John F. McManus

President


John F. McManus joined the staff of The John Birch Society in August 1966, serving originally as a field coordinator for several New England states. In 1968, he was transferred to a position at the Society's national headquarters.  In 1973, Mr. McManus accepted appointment by Robert Welch, the Society's Founder, as the organization's Director of Public Affairs. In this post, he became and remains the Society's chief media representative throughout the nation. He has appeared on hundreds of radio and television programs. He is one of the Society's few authorized spokesmen.


Mr. McManus has written and produced numerous audio-visual programs, including the popular DVD Overview of America, which is a moving tribute about America's Constitutional roots. He has also written several books including "Financial Terrorism" (1993), "Changing Commands: The Betrayal of America's Military" (1995), "William F. Buckley, Jr.: Pied Piper for the Establishment" (2002), and The Insiders 5th Edition (2004). He is in wide demand as a speaker. 

In addition to being a regular contributor of articles to The New American, he serves as its publisher. He is also publisher of the Society's member-only monthly Bulletin. Mr. McManus was named president of The John Birch Society in 1991. 

Born in 1935 in Brooklyn, New York, he is a graduate of Holy Cross College in Massachusetts. He served on active duty as a lieutenant in the U.S. Marine Corps for three years. For six years before accepting a staff position with the Society, he was employed as an electronics engineer.
