results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

All games must end by 8:45pm

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, January 6th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The January session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (January 6th - 27th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 16-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (January 6th - 27th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (January 5th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

results.description:
The Chinese history has long fascinated me, especially that of the tumultuous 19th and 20th century. With my friend Neil, who has read quite a few books on the subject, we're hoping more can join us as we discuss this period that has shaped the modern China. You don't have to be an expert on the subject (we are not!), just have an interest and enjoy friendly discussion. 


The discussion will be in English. I'll go over a few landmark events and major players for their Chinese names / translation (鸦片战争, 文化大革命, etc.) We welcome diverse perspectives on the history as we first review the established facts and what we have learned. We trust that history can be reflected upon with an open mind and discussed amicably.

The major events we hope to cover: 

1. [masked]: First Opium War. British force China to "open" on unequal terms


2. 1856 - 1860: Second Opium War / Summer Palace destroyed.  


3. [masked]: Boxer rebellion against foreign influence.

4. 1911: Republican Revolution (Xinhai Revolution)

5. [masked]: Warlord Era

6. 1919: The May 4th Movement.  Opposition to WWI Versailles Treaty which China did not sign / European and American powers ignored China's fear of Japanese attack


7. 1921: Communist Party founded

8. [masked]: Guomindang unifies part of China; capital at Nanjing

9. 1931: Japanese take Manchuria / 1937: Japanese invade North China

10. [masked]: Guomindang-Communist Civil War / 1949: Guomindang defeated, retreats to Taiwan; People's Republic founded


11. 1958: Great Leap Forward and People's Communes / Great Chinese Famine

12. 1960: Sino-Soviet split

13. 1962 Sino-Indian War

14. 1964: The Chinese government detonated its first nuclear weapon at Lop Nur

15. [masked]: The Cultural Revolution

16. 1972: Nixon visits Beijing

17. 1978: Deng Xiaoping and the economic reform

18. 1979: Formal recognition by the U.S.

We will be sure to learn from our discussion. Join us!
results.how_to_find_us: A table with Meetup sign in the sculpture garden / atrium. And Kat has very bright red hair :)
results.name: Jan.20 Chinese History Discussion: 1842 (First Opium War)-1978 (Economic Reform)

results.description:
Interested in out-of-body experiences and psychic experiences? Your welcome to join us at one of free public seminars!

Have you ever had a vivid flying dream? How about the sensation of floating while falling asleep or meditating? How about the perception of “dropping” back into your body just before waking up? If so it may be possible that you have experienced what is called an out-of-body experience. It has sometimes been known in various spiritual traditions and schools of thought in history, as “astral projection” or “soul travel”.

Despite being considered by many to be a strange or obscure topic, the experience has been reported for thousands of years by people all over the world, often mixed up with dreams. Throughout history people have reported “otherworldly” journeys and spiritual experiences into other dimensions in a variety of settings - during spiritual practices (i.e meditation, prayer, etc), near-death, during sleep or spontaneously during the day. What is interesting is that unbeknownst to most of the public, is that the out-of-body experience is a powerful tool for self-transformation, self-discovery and wellness and can be willfully induced, developed, controlled and utilized to greatly benefit yourself and others. The experience is much like the altered states of consciousness that shamans and medicine men in history used to connect with the psychic world, obtain knowledge, heal others, etc.

This short seminar is offered freely to the public and will provide you with cutting edge information on out-of-body experiences (i.e. astral projection, soul travel, etc), subtle energy, non-physical dimensions and related topics. Cutting through misconceptions and misinformation about the topic, you will learn about the latest research on these experiences, including their benefits (see below) and – unbeknownst to most of us – how they already affect our daily life yet have huge implications about who you are and your life purpose.
Some of the benefits of the out-of-body experience are:

• Understanding non-physical dimensions or realities
• Direct contact with spirit guides
• Development of psychic abilities
• Losing the fear of death
• Getting information about your life purpose
• Using OBEs as a tool to assist or heal others
• Psychic awareness and protection
• Development of universalism and fraternity

In addition to these benefits, these additional fascinating topics will be discussed at the lecture:

• Our multidimensional nature
• How the OBE experience (i.e astral projection, etc) works
• How an OBE is experienced first hand
• Astral projection tips, benefits & utilities
• How to use the OBE to discover our life purpose
• Psychic abilities related to the OBE
• Our multiple subtle bodies and their function
• What current research tells us about the OBE
• Overview of easy out-of-body experience techniques
• Non physical dimensions
• What happens psychically at night
• Information about IAC’s OBE and psychic training programs
• Answers to questions you have about these topics or your experiences

Is this lecture right for you?

This lecture is packed with fascinating information and is interesting to both those new to the topic, or those already quite knowledgeable about it. Whether you’re just curious about the topic, want to ask about an experience you had, or what to go deeper, this lecture is for you. It is well suited for anyone planning on further study but still looking for a rational, integrated overview of these frequently misunderstood topics.

If you are interested in IAC’s other programs, note that this free lecture is an ideal (although optional) starting point for people interested in taking IAC’s other courses. It allows would-be students to make a personal connection with our instructors and team, obtaining confidence in our knowledge, approach, and framework. This lecture also introduces our organization, and gives an overview of our curriculum, programs, and publications. Hence it is a great opportunity to ask an instructor about IAC's main OBE training course, the award-winning Consciousness Development Program (CDP), which we offer regularly in New York.

Who teaches this free lecture? 

It is taught by one of IAC’s senior faculty members, depending on who’s available. IAC’s faculty members have years of experience and training in spirituality and consciousness studies, including out-of-body experiences and psychic phenomena. IAC is an educational and research centered organization in the area of consciousness studies, human potential and psychic development, and has offices in over 12 countries worldwide.

How do I attend?

Confirm via meetup that you're attending or email us to register at newyork (-at-) iacworld.org

results.name: Free Seminar on Out-of-Body Experiences and Consciousness Studies

results.description:
Happy New Year Players, 


I have a feeling that in 2016 we are going to see some amazing new tech come out of the crowdsourcing wave and the New York startup market in general. It's more than a feeling, in fact, because I have 3 incredible companies lined up for this meetup. Let's get our hands on their tech and play with it (and, of course, help the founders improve it).

Let's meet on January 20th at 7pm at the usual location. Remember to bring your smartphone, tablet, and/or laptop - something you can use to look at websites and download apps. Or you could look on with someone else - which is fun too. We'll have pizza and refreshments, RSVP early so we know how much to get. Can't wait to see you all. 

Here are the companies that will be presenting. As always, I give you little information on purpose so that you encounter their product for the first time in front of the founders and can share your initial (even visceral) reactions. Feel free to do your own research, but it'll be more fun if you don't. 

Stack.ai

See who you have and have not been in touch with. Schedule followups and complete them. Drive your relationships forward. That should be general enough for you not to quite figure it out ahead of time, right?

Thimble.io


A monthly subscription that delivers electronics kits and online courses to students, programmers, and hobbyists in the US & around the World. That pretty much gives it away but that's ALL I'm telling you, got it?

Pionear

Pionear lets anyone record audio and tag it to a place for others to discover. Make custom audio tours, site specific stories or geo-triggered music. Pionear is an instrument for telling stories about the world around you.
results.name: Let's meet up and play with new tech

results.description:
COME CHECK OUT THE FIRST DAY OF THIS FIVE WEEK WORKSHOP FOR ONLY $5 BUCKS!

Meditative Writing with Jessica Hinds

“It took me four years to paint like Raphael, but a lifetime to paint like a child.” – Pablo Picasso

There was a time when creativity was easy—when you were a child, driven by an endless desire to create, and no fear, no judgment, and no internal censor whatsoever.

The goal of meditative writing is to return you to that time, when finding your voice as a writer was as easy as being yourself, and raw creativity flowed as effortlessly as inspiration.

You’ll learn to banish writer’s block forever, find inspiration in an instant, and discover the heart of your story and your characters, by tapping into your own voice as a writer, and your deepest creative instincts.

How Does It Work?

Each session begins with a short guided meditation, followed by a series of carefully crafted meditative writing exercises, designed to transport you out of your everyday life, and connect you to the emotional truth of your story and of your characters.

Over 5 weeks, you’ll build a writing practice that allows you to get your pages flowing at will, recover the joy you’ve always felt with writing, and write from your most connected place every time you sit down with your characters.

Meetup Members can check out the first session for only $5 bucks with no obligation, to decide if the class is right for you!

Who Should Take Meditative Writing?


Whether you are brand new to writing, or a seasoned writer looking to inject energy back into your writing, meditative writing will change your writing life forever.

Designed for writers of all types, including screenwriters, playwrights, poets, novelists, and writers of any other genre, here are just a few of the many benefits of this approach:

Uncovering the Real Emotional Underbelly That Drives Great Films

Discovering Your True Voice

Creating More Provocative Dialogue, Images and Action

Developing an “Inspiration on Command” Writing Schedule

Injecting Joy Into Your Writing Process

Getting in Touch With Your Characters

Finding the Heart of Your Story

Discovering Theme

Natural Subtext

Opening Up Your Creative Side

Learning How To Write Even When You Can’t Find a “Quiet Place”

Connecting Yourself To Your Characters and Story Even If You Are Working On Assignment

Writing Cooler, Bigger, More Intense and Compelling Scenes

Learning To Love Your Weirdness and Understand Its Value

Relaxation

Confidence

Focus

Banishing Writers Block Forever

Fun!

Learn more.

----

NORMAL COST: $350

MEETUP MEMBERS:  Check out the first day of this  5-week workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!

Class Size is Strictly Limited To Allow All Students The Opportunity to Workshop And Receive Feedback On Their Writing. You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

PLEASE PLAN TO ARRIVE 5 MINUTES EARLY TO ASSURE THAT YOU DO NOT DISTURB THE MEDITATION.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the elevator to the sixth floor and enter the door on your right!

results.description:
What do you do when you have a really bright kid who's having a really hard time succeeding academically, socially, emotionally?

You meet up with other parents who are sharing a similar experience.


About the first 2e parent meetup on Long Island...

Fourteen years ago I formed a small parent group on Long Island which, over the course of three years, evolved into Twice Exceptional Children's Advocacy, a grassroots organization that provided nearly one hundred families with information and resources for parenting 2e children: high potential and gifted children with ADHD, dyslexia, high functioning autism, anxiety, sensory processing challenges or, simply, underachievement.

At the core of the organization a parent peer group was formed -- a safe and nonjudgmental group of intelligent and resourceful parents who had both questions to ask and answers to share. For many of us it was the first time we didn't have to explain or make excuses for our kids (which was a relief because our kids are not easy to explain). It was also the first time that we, and our children, were immediately understood and accepted. Through that group information was shared, social opportunities were created for parents and children, and lasting relationships, both personal and professional, were formed. Some of those relationships culminated in programs like a talent development mentor program for young 2e musicians and Nassau Community College's Achilles program for 2e college students. In both my personal and professional experience I have found that parents of twice exceptionally gifted kids are some of the most interesting, resourceful, innovative, brave and resilient parents I've ever met. By starting this group I hope to renew the energy among parents that Twice Exceptional Children's Advocacy generated through monthly gatherings.

As a consultant, psychotherapist and parent I am happy to share my personal and professional knowledge and experience, and to offer parenting tips and strategies. I would also encourage you to share your ideas, including what has worked/not worked with, and for your children.

Let's get together and talk about...

- what 2e is... and isn't

- communicating with our kids

- building parent/child relationships

- collaborating with schools

- friendships

- siblings/family relationships

- interventions & therapies (medical/alternative)

- extracurricular/enrichment (and how to create what doesn't exist

- and anything 2e you'd like to talk about that I haven't listed.

This meetup is for parents of 2e kids of all ages -- we all have something valuable to share.

I look forward to seeing you soon!
results.name: Let's get to know each other and share our 2e parenting experiences.

group.name: Sea Cliff Parents of Gifted/Twice Exceptional Kids Meetup

results.description:
Join us to learn about, talk about, install, and build Sandstorm & personal server apps!

Sandstorm is an open source operating system for personal and private clouds. You can read more about it here: https://sandstorm.io/

This meetup is a casual Q&A to help Michael Nutt (the meetup host, and author of Davros on Sandstorm) learn what we're all interested in, so we can decide what to do at future events.

BONUS: Asheesh Laroia, a Sandstorm core developer, is in town, so through discussions you'll gain extra insight into the past and future of the project!

If you're:

- Excited about personal servers

- Curious how open source web apps can be viable when competing against big software-as-a-service products

- Aware of Sandstorm and want to learn more

then you should attend this meetup. **Bring a laptop** if you want to get hands-on!

Schedule:

- 7:00 PM: Attendees arrive. Informal discussions begin.

- 9:00 PM: Movable Ink closes their doors.

This meetup is graciously hosted & sponsored by Movable Ink. Food and drinks will be provided!
results.name: Sandstorm meet & greet. Newcomers welcome! Special guest Asheesh Laroia

results.description:
Come make ecstatic, spontaneous choral music with us! We gather for two hours of improvised group singing on the third Wednesday of the month.

CircleSinging is a form of facilitated Vocal Improv which could be described as “a drum circle for singers” or “improvised choral music.” During the course of the ever-changing chant, the leader develops and gives parts to a circle of singers, which in turn supports individual solos. Both participating in and witnessing the creation of the music that emerges is an exhilarating and joyful experience.

Please note: Bringing water to drink is recommended but CAP21 also sells water bottles at the front desk.

Admission is $15 - $30 sliding scale. Please be generous to the extent you can afford. (No one will be turned away for lack of funds.) For more information, please contact Ben at[masked]-8918.
results.name: January CircleSing! at New Location: CAP21 Studios (room 612)

Better Off Bowling is kicking off a new season on Sunday afternoons this Winter and I thought I'd create an event for our group since there was a lot of interest previously! We played last season and it was a blast! Just to be clear, you have to register/pay through the leagues website in order to be a part of the league, not just RSVP here! :)

They've given us an amazing discount for the season! To get $10 off the regular registration price use code NYCMUWIN16 . I've already created a team for our group called Pin Ups - here's the link: https://www.betteroffbowling.com/teams/6195-Pin-Ups

and you can get info on the season here: http://www.Betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg

Also, there are some other group members who are making their own teams with friends, so feel free to do that as well. It doesn't matter if you're a horrible bowler or a great one as this league is mainly about fun and meeting people, so that's right up our alley! PLUS! If Sundays don’t work for you there is a Tuesday night option as well! We have a team with the same name in that league you can join!

Better Off Bowling, New York‘s Biggest Social Bowling League! 

Hundreds of fun young professionals (20's and 30's), co-ed and non-competitive, and at only $79 (with discount code) for the entire season, incredibly affordable!

results.description:
Truth is at best partial, at worst error. We are at best explorers, at worst believers. If we desire to fully grow we must keep exploring. . . Welcome Explorers! (And curious believers too!)

This is a group for exploring and testing each other's new ideas, and for the potential of creating even more together!

As a starting point we'll discuss the possibility of:

A natural morality based on our passion's values;

A politics that roots out resentment so we can enjoy

a unified diversity;

And a culture of 7 billion honest individuals---

with not one truth!

 

This morality, politics, and culture have one goal: That we each flourish--that we each fully bloom into all that we are--together.

 

Can it happen? Should it happen? What do you propose? Let's talk about it!

 

 

Note: Ripple Effect Photo by Segiu Bacioiu.

results.description:
7:00- Pre-Intermediate Level

Intermediate WCS is a continuation for students who have completed the Beginner Level or possess a good understanding of the basic patterns as well as,  the principles of timing and partnering. Emphasis will be on the continuing development of partnering skills, lead and follow, dance floor etiquette, a good understanding of timing, and the ability to execute simple sequences. New steps and turn patterns will be introduced and linked together to develop new combinations.


8:00- Beginner Level

Beginner WCS Level is an introductory course, which gives a foundation of movement for students who have had little or no dance experience. Emphasis will be on the development of partnering skills, lead and follow, the basic principles of timing, as well as basic foot work and basic patterns.

We suggest between 2 and 4 months in Beginner Level  before you move on to the next Level.

9:15- WCS Party
results.how_to_find_us: Press 007 at the door and Join us to the 3d floor
results.name: West Coast Swing Classes Beginner to Advance + WCS party

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Hey Everyone!

Better Off Bowling is kicking off a new season on Sunday afternoons this Winter and I thought I'd create an event for our group since there was a lot of interest previously! We played last season and it was a blast! Just to be clear, you have to register/pay through the leagues website in order to be a part of the league, not just RSVP here! :)

They've given us an amazing discount for the season! To get $10 off the regular registration price use code NYCMUWIN16 . I've already created a team for our group called Here for the Beer - here's the link: https://www.betteroffbowling.com/teams/6190-Here-for-the-Beer

and you can get info on the season here: http://www.Betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg

Also, there are some other group members who are making their own teams with friends, so feel free to do that as well. It doesn't matter if you're a horrible bowler or a great one as this league is mainly about fun and meeting people, so that's right up our alley! PLUS! results.description:
To CJK Experts and Native Speakers:

We practice like this (including, but not limited to):

Session 1 (7pm-8pm): Interpretation methods practice

For example, words, phrases or sentences interpretation, target language repeating, shadowing and summarization, etc.

We set two tables to practice Chinese and Korean separately (Japanese is on hiatus due to low membership). The session is basically for intermediate & above Chinese and Korean learners.

Session 2 (8pm-9pm): Topic-based speaking practice

Summary, speak or discuss the topic you are provided or you have prepared by your target language (Chinese & Korean).

Also, everybody can move to any table as they want.

If you would like to practice English, please join our regular Saturday meetup generously hosted by Carl.

Looking forward to practicing with you all!

Organizers
results.name: Regular Interpretation & Speaking CJK Practice

results.description:
Biliteracy is an important part of bilingual education, yet, teaching children how to read and write in both languages can be challenging. Unlike learning to speak in more than one language, learning to read and write is not something that children necessarily pick up easily by just being around their German speaking parents. That is something parents will need to foster. This seminar shows different approaches of teaching biliteracy, and explains the process of learning to read in the German language. We will describe how parents can support their children, and discuss challenging situations that are common in bilingual families. The seminar will conclude with practical ideas and exercises to foster literacy in german, from how to make learning fun for beginners, to tips for children who can already read to some extend.

Speaker: Andrea Pieper

Andrea is a licensed speech therapist and the Language Program Deputy Coordinator at Deutsches Haus NYU

THIS WORKSHOP IS HELD IN GERMAN!

REGISTER HERE
results.name: SEMINAR: Biliteracy - Teaching your Children to Read and Write in German

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 3 spots besides myself for this meetup. 

Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 3 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 3 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place:


As Zagat states: Bobby Flay “hits the nail on the head” at this "happening" NoHo Med where his “wonderfully creative” dishes “burst” with “bold flavors”; a "downtown sceney" crowd keeps the "industrial" digs feeling “cool”, and a large front bar area is a “nice alternative” if you can’t “snag” a coveted rez.


http://gatonyc.com/


RSVPs: 

Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.


Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description:
Restaurant week is a good chance to try a lot of fine restaurants in the city. Delmonico's is one of the oldest restaurants in New York City, "the first restaurant" in the United States, according to their website. It's $38 for three course prix fixe, not including tax and tip. A $3.00 meet up fee will be added to your bill. 

The menu: http://www.delmonicosrestaurant.com/events.html

From their website: In 1827, at the beginning of New York City's evolution as the financial center of the world, the genesis of what would become a world renowned culinary institution, Delmonico's Restaurant, was set. A small shop selling classically prepared pastries, fine coffee and chocolate, bonbons, wines and liquors as well as Havana cigars was operated by the Delmonico brothers. Its success led them to purchase a triangular plot of land at the intersection of Beaver, William and South William Streets where, in 1837, they opened the first fine dining restaurant in the country. Delmonico's offered an unheard of luxury – the availability of private dining rooms (located on the third floor) where discriminate entertaining was the order of the day. The basement held the restauranteur's treasure, the largest private wine cellar in the city, holding an impressive 1,000 bottles of the world's finest wines. It was during these early years that Chef Alessandro Fellippini began to develop the restaurant's culinary identity with the house special, Delmonico Steak.

Yelp page: http://www.yelp.com/biz/delmonicos-new-york
results.how_to_find_us: Reservation under the name "Angela Chung"
results.name: Restaurant Week at Delmonico's, "First Restaurant in America"

results.description:
How to become #1 Kaggler

This non-technical talk will describe how the presenter transitioned from a software developer in a corporate IT to a data scientist in a startup, with a focus on the practical lessons learned and interesting points observed along the way.


Owen Zhang is the Chief Product Officer at DataRobot, and is ranked #1 on the Kaggle leaderboard out of a community of 200,000 data scientists. Owen spent most of his career in the Property & Casualty insurance industry, most recently serving as Vice President of Modeling in the newly formed AIG Science team. After spending several years in IT building transactional systems for commercial insurance, Owen discovered his passion in Machine Learning and started building insurance underwriting, pricing, and claims models. Owen has a Masters degree in Electrical Engineering from University of Toronto and a Bachelors degree from University of Science and Technology of China.

Transparent, Reproducible Journalism

Jeremy Singer-Vine will talk about how BuzzFeed News uses data analysis for its investigative articles and why and how his team open-sources its methodologies, code, and data.

Jeremy Singer-Vine is the data editor at BuzzFeed.  Previously, he worked at the Wall Street Journal, and was co-named a finalist for the 2014 Pulitzer Prize in National Reporting. Jeremy is also a co-organizer of Hacks/Hackers New York City.
results.how_to_find_us: Take the L to Morgan exit on Bogart Street and head past the swallow cafe, take a right on to Moore, keep going a block past Roberta's then we are behind the black gate just after the Brooklyn Bread Lab.
results.name: Owen Zhang (Data Robot, #1 Kaggler) & Jeremy Singer-Vine (BuzzFeed)

results.description:
Happy New Year, Legal Hackers! 

We are pleased to announce a brand new format for New York Legal Hackers meetups: Jam Sessions. Legal Hackers Jam Sessions are monthly small-group working sessions that are geared to address a specific problem in a quick sprint. Jam Sessions will differ from our regular panel events in two ways: (1) smaller group size (only 12 people per session to start, excluding organizers), and (2) more interactivity--bring your laptops and other small computing devices. One LH member will lead each Jam Session by posing a problem, with background, relevant to the Legal Hackers community, perhaps in connection with a personal project, perhaps soliciting support for a group project. From there, we will do our best to pose a real solution to that problem in a 3-4 hour sprint. At the end of each Jam Session, we will vote to determine if we need another Jam Session to keep things going, or if we're ready to move on.


Important things to note:


• Unfortunately, we will have to strictly enforce the RSVP list because space is very limited. 

• Jam Sessions are not replacing our regular panel events.


• As with all our events (other than hackathons), anything generated during Jam Sessions should be contributed to the group on a Creative Commons or Open Source basis.


Our first Jam Session will be led by Gabriel Botelho, founder of Justice Pipes. Justice Pipes is an open source platform for state courts and local justice agencies to manage their data, with a particular focus on docket information. For this Session, we are looking for designers and coders (as always), plus folks who have expertise in the following areas and who can share non-confidential info:


• Open Source Systems 

• Government Contracting 

• Court Docket Systems 

• Free Legal Information on the State/Local Levels 

If you can meaningfully contribute anything on these fronts, we strongly encourage you to attend. RSVPs will be honored on a first-come, first-serve basis--please only RSVP if you definitely plan to attend.

Until then, Rock On!
results.name: Jam Session v.001: Justice Pipes

The meeting will feature a chat via Skype with<a> 3D Crave's</a> Co-founder & CEO Jose Marra. 3D Crave is a 3D content developer/provider that brings 3D content to TVs via a Roku channel.

We've just added Ingo Nadler, the Founder of a new VR platform: Hashplay who will be discussing the new network and VR content requirements. He'll visit us from Germany Via Skype.

There will also be a presentation on the Light Field imaging camera:<a> Lytro</a>. Learn about the amazing technology that allows for the creation of single images with multiple depths in focus and see examples of these moving stills on the big screen. Due to how you compose an image with a Plenoptic camera, folks who shoot 3D develop the Zen and are particularly well suited to exploit this technology. Read the paper that got me interested: 


<a>http://www.cs.cmu.edu/afs/cs/academic/class/15869-f11/www/readings/ng06_thesis.pdf</a>;

results.description: Come to our purely positive séance where we encourage mystics, psychics, mediums and all people to enhance their spiritual awareness in a safe and empowering environment. All of our séance conductors are highly trained and renowned mediums. Whether you are looking to connect with a loved one who has recently passed or to receive messages from spirit, our group offers a warm and friendly environment to all who are interested. Before each séance we begin our group with a 15 minute lesson on psychic development, covering topics from psychic impressions to spirit communication. We then begin our séance with a nondenominational prayer of protection and lead a guided visual mediation. After the meditation each person who attends will receive a message from one of our highly trained séance conductors. All participants are guaranteed to receive a message. Our group meets for approximately 2 hours. The purpose of our séance is to communicate directly with spirit and to form an open and inviting spiritual community in New York City Our meeting times are every other Wednesday Night at 7:00pm and our fee is $20. Please be timely, because we do not open our doors once we begin our meditation (for obvious reasons :). For legal purposes it is understood that our group and the messages given at our séances are for entertainment purposes only.
results.name: Seance in The City Meetup

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.

results.description:
We open on New York City, in the modern nights, following a period of great instability. To date, the party has variously used the chaos of the Malkavia outbreak and turbulence in the wake of Strix plots within the city to advance personal agendas, seize power and ultimately emerge as a true movers and shakers. Every Kindred institution has come under their influence,


- The Ordo Dracul was first to see their value as information and favor trading lead their leader Fong to trust and ally with the coterie

- The Invictus has seen its remaining elders dispatched, Stringer Bell cast into torpor, John Jay Astor killed, Therese Voerman blood-bound and The Baron forced to flee the Unholy; with John Max seizing all assets.

- The Circle of the Crone had few elders survive the Malkavia, and of those two, the party has killed Ming Xiao and driven The Blair Witch to be blood-bound by Prada. Their desperate plan to revive an ancient legendary elder only lead to another powerful blood-slave for Prada.

- The Carthian Movement was swept up in the furor of a demagogue Strix hell bent on a literal "Eat the Rich!" campaign, with only Oddvar emerging unscathed from the resulting diabelerie blood hunt. With their last elder Walt seemingly despondent and poised to leave the scene, the future of the Momvent is uncertain.

- The Lancea Sanctum rules the city, but the Prince must deal with the realities of the political landscape, which means dealing with the players.


Additionally, in the process of carrying out their personal vendettas the coterie has seized control of the large scale criminal enterprises of the city, enslaved judiciary figures and made deals with various other supernatural individuals and organizations.


But each of the Demented raved of an apocalypse to come, other precognitive societies have distanced themselves from the Kindred and retreated underground, and the Cacophony is stirring with stories.. unbelievable stories.
results.name: Vampire the Requiem 2E: Dark and Full of Terrors

The Joule Thief - A super-bright flashlight that runs on dead batteries. WHAT?! Exclusive MakerBar Swag Edition developed by members! - $10 - 1 Hour - Easy Difficulty

The Sonic Pencil - A pencil that makes extraordinarily silly sounds as you draw. Great soldering and fun for kids and adults. Exclusive MakerBar Swag Edition based on Drawdio open hardware! - $20 - 1.5 Hours - Easy Difficulty

XProtolab - An entire electronics bench on a circuit smaller than most erasers. Snaps into a breadboard and features a dual-channel oscilloscope, logic analyzer, FFT, voltmeter... Dense surface-mount soldering with special components means you'll use special toys to build it! Expert solderers only. Yes, it actually works; you can try ours first. - $35 - 3 Hours - Extreme Difficulty

Soldering Wednesday is open to the public and repeats on the third Wednesday of every month. The event is organized by Travis Jones.

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.] 


MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.  

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar

results.description:
https://email01.secureserver.net/download.php?rand=272818&folder=INBOX&uid=194133&part=1.2&tnef_part=-1&aEmlPart=0&orig=cid%3Aii_ij7hhh1q2_15227c9516ea3886&inline=1&filename=Sweet_Healing_Banner-L1b-water.jpg&type=image%2Fjpeg&encoding=base64&;
Come enjoy a talk and conversation:Inspire and teach yourself to achieve and sustain vital wellness (if you can stand the suspense)!

Use this breathtaking new book to go on a psychological journey that instills a lasting affinity for health and well-being.

Pick up this book as a great read or a wonderful gift that keeps on giving.

Bring your questions, as Michael will discuss being present, goal-setting, emotions, and methods of gaining wellness portrayed in the novel he wrote on the shift from dis-ease to thriving.

Find out why healing leaders and educators rave about Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey, and why readers are reading it twice and sharing it with loved ones:

"Sweet Healing, by Michael Bedar, touches the heart and opens the mind's eye."
– Dr. Brian Clement, Director of Hippocrates Health Center 

“Sweet Healing rocks! It’s a heck of an adventure for novel lovers; it’s a tale that will touch anyone who has been effected by the epidemic of diabetes and chronic disease...a gripping read of fiction that will leave you inspired, motivated, and hungry for a healthier lifestyle. Devour this book and share it with your friends now!”
– Cathy Silvers, actor from the TV sitcom, Happy Days, author of Happy Days, Healthy Living 

“The dedication Michael Bedar has put into his wonderful new book, Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey, offers a proven and essential alternative narrative to help you observe and identify what blocks you in life, and incorporate lifestyle practices you can use for whole-person health.”
– From the Foreword by Gabriel Cousens, MD, MD(H), author of Conscious Eating and There Is a Cure for Diabetes


​Join researcher, author of the new novel, Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey, Michael Bedar. Join us for exploration of foundations themes, practices, and a few tips from this newly released book!“Sweet Healing is filled with Michael’s dedication, caring, and generous personality, infused with serving and raising awareness for the world around him as if it were his own family. In this book you’ll find a great story to help avail yourself to wisdom and knowledge about eating and living a healthier lifestyle. A story written like this comes from someone walking his talk. Sweet Healing is inspiring to those suffering with preventable and reversible illnesses, so they may create new habits and ways of living that reinforce a loving, healthy sense of self.”
– Debbie Merrill, US Figure Skating Silver-Medalist, author of Raw Truth to the Fountain of Youth, host of The Debbie Merrill Show


 “If you or you family are faced with the challenge of type 2 diabetes, I recommend that you read Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey now. It is an indispensable parable. It will take you on a possible journey to better health and a life empowered by positive choices, informed by proven research and presented as an entertaining read." 
– Mike Adams, the Health Ranger, editor of Natural News


“For people searching, this book is a parable about waking up and getting your spark back par excellence! I heartily and excitedly recommend Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey as a boon to those who want to find out what’s possible in the realm of their well-being. Read it on a plane, in bed, in a book club, or on your train commute–just READ it!”
– Nomi Shannon, Author of What Do Raw Fooders Eat 1 & 2, The Raw Gourmet, and Raw Food Celebrations

"Sweet Healing - A Whole Health Journey is a 'Way of the Peaceful Warrior' and 'Celestine Prophecy'-type adventure for today's epidemic times."
- Annie Padden Jubb, author of Secrets of an Alkaline Body, owner of LifeFood Restaurant Chain

“If you know someone who’s faced with type 2 diabetes or a degenerative metabolic health crisis, I highly recommend this inspirational novel! In Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey, the characters demonstrate how each small step in the process of healing builds upon itself. This book inspires readers to take a proactive approach to their healing and offers innovative tips for health, happiness, and longevity.”
– Marci Shimoff, #1 New York Times bestselling author of Happy for No Reason and Love for No Reason

“Sweet Healing is a heart-touching and inspiring novel about holistic approaches to healing and preventing metabolic syndrome and diabetes. With vivid story-telling, Michael Bedar helps us understand the deeper meanings of wellness and healing; uplifting and potentially transformational!”
 – Dr. Will Tuttle, author of the best-selling book, The World Peace Diet

"Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey is a unique and entertaining approach to getting a very important message across. You'll learn more about the personal side of diabetes and metabolic syndrome effects, and how to deal with them, in this short novel than you will be reading medical documents. Well done!!"
- Mike Anderson, director of the film Eating, author of Healing Cancer from the Inside Out, founder of RAVEdiet.com

“This book was amazing. Michael Bedar’s expertise in his field of holistic healing is surpassed only by the dedication and love he has for serving people. Sweet Healing is a kaleidoscopic journey into the little known (until now) subject of naturally recovering from type 2 diabetes. If you are diabetic or know someone who is, read this book, and awaken into wellness. It just may save your life.”
– Frank Ferrante, subject of the award-winning documentary, May I Be Frank, and author of the book, May I Be Frank

“In this wonderful book, Michael Bedar lays out a framework that can guide us all back to using food and movement as the most powerful tools to maintain our health and vitality. I use Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey as a trusted resource with all of my patients diagnosed with diabetes and other degenerative diseases.”
– Harry McIlroy, MD, Integrative Physician

Sweet Healing takes you on an inspiring whole health journey that frees you to enjoy every day of your life. Get life-altering inspiration and everyday practices to transform and sustain your wellness using this breathtaking new book to go on a psychological, physical, and soulful journey that is proven to leave you with a lasting affinity for healthy living now!

​See the blog for readers' comments at www.readsweethealing.com

When: Wednesday, January 20, 2016 from 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM (EST) 

Where: Health Liberties Network, 42 New England Drive, Ramsey, NJ  07446

Cost for your health: $10 with rsvp to Karen, $15 at the door

RSVP to Karen at [masked] or call[masked] and leave your name for rsvp list. See you on January 20th.

Co-Hosted by NYC Open Data meetup and NYC Data Science Academy meetup.

*** Apply for April[masked] week full time bootcamp program to be a Data Scientist *** 

==========================================

We are looking for venue and food sponsorship for this Jan 20th event! write to [masked] if you would love to offer. Thanks a lot!

Speaker:Yann LeCun, Facebook AI Research & New York University

Description: Deep Learning has revolutionized computer vision and speech recognition, and is well on its way to profoundly transform natural language understanding. The main advantage of deep learning is that it automates the process of designing good features for a machine learning system. Yann will review the basic ideas and methods of deep learning and describe a number of large-scale practical applications in image understanding and natural language understanding. Beyond traditional ML applications, the long-term goal of deep learning is to enable progress towards AI systems. Yann will talk about some of the challenges on the path to AI.

Bio of speaker:

Yann LeCun is Director of AI Research at Facebook, and Silver Professor of Data Science, Computer Science, Neural Science, and Electrical Engineering at New York University, affiliated with the NYU Center for Data Science, the Courant Institute of Mathematical Science, the Center for Neural Science, and the Electrical and Computer Engineering Department. 

He received the Electrical Engineer Diploma from Ecole Supérieure d'Ingénieurs en Electrotechnique et Electronique (ESIEE), Paris in 1983, and a PhD in Computer Science from Université Pierre et Marie Curie (Paris) in 1987. After a postdoc at the University of Toronto, he joined AT&T Bell Laboratories in Holmdel, NJ in 1988. He became head of the Image Processing Research Department at AT&T Labs-Research in 1996, and joined NYU as a professor in 2003, after a brief period as a Fellow of the NEC Research Institute in Princeton. From 2012 to 2014 he directed NYU's initiative in data science and became the founding director of the NYU Center for Data Science. He was named Director of AI Research at Facebook in late 2013 and retains a part-time position on the NYU faculty. 

His current interests include AI, machine learning, computer perception, mobile robotics, and computational neuroscience. He has published over 180 technical papers and book chapters on these topics as well as on neural networks, handwriting recognition, image processing and compression, and on dedicated circuits and architectures for computer perception. The character recognition technology he developed at Bell Labs is used by several banks around the world to read checks and was reading between 10 and 20% of all the checks in the US in the early 2000s. His image compression technology, called DjVu, is used by hundreds of web sites and publishers and millions of users to access scanned documents on the Web. Since the mid 1980's he has been working on deep learning methods, particularly the convolutional network model, which is the basis of many products and services deployed by companies such as Facebook, Google, Microsoft, Baidu, IBM, NEC, AT&T and others for image and video understanding, document recognition, human-computer interaction, and speech recognition. 

LeCun has been on the editorial board of IJCV, IEEE PAMI, and IEEE Trans. Neural Networks, was program chair of CVPR'06, and is chair of ICLR 2013 and 2014. He is on the science advisory board of Institute for Pure and Applied Mathematics, and Neural Computation and Adaptive Perception Program of the Canadian Institute for Advanced Research. He has advised many large and small companies about machine learning technology, including several startups he co-founded. He is the lead faculty at NYU for the Moore-Sloan Data Science Environment, a $36M initiative in collaboration with UC Berkeley and University of Washington to develop data-driven methods in the sciences. He is the recipient of the 2014 IEEE Neural Network Pioneer Award.
results.name: Learn Deep Learning with one of the most world well known scholars

results.description:
https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/cENnBlBMOufwq1krfzvaVj_xSrek2Y_WlC7SR_XHKCB8b57iLDyqZYWw5TjaX6TqRVdzPwFZg1fQixqzKpTFXz9lKgIBjTSa_g_ffvgZ2kEaq9BAhaSdbNobmQrlwYhjvC4SEGq9

Join Marcos Salazar, Co-founder and Executive Director of Be Social Change, and Leslie G. Schultz, President of BRIC, on Wednesday, January 20th, for an intimate fireside chat on what it takes to lead one of the largest free cultural programs in New York City focused on supporting artists and media makers in Brooklyn.

===================================

Official RSVP on Eventbrite: bit.ly/BSCFiresideBRIC

===================================

Together, Marcos and Leslie will delve into her life story, from her prior work as a partner at the law firm Manatt Phelps & Phillips, focusing on capital projects and governance for a range of nonprofits, to her work at BRIC over the past 10 years. They will explore the challenges and successes of leading a 100+ staff through implementing a new strategic plan, launching and re-organizing programs, and opening a new 40,000 square foot multi-disciplinary arts and media center in Downtown Brooklyn.

About BSC Firesides

BSC Firesides are intimate discussions with founders, thought leaders, and innovators in the social impact space. Marcos dives deep with guests about new ideas, best practices, and lessons learned in developing innovative ways of growing purpose + impact. While our BSC “Future of” Series are panel discussions about a specific topic or theme, BSC Fireside provide a space to not only delve into the unique expertise of our guest but also into origin stories of the innovative nonprofit, purpose-driven business or social good startup they are leading as well as the personality behind someone driving a movement or new way of thinking when creating social change.

Join the conversation on Twitter with:

@besocialchange | @marcossalazar | @BRICartsmedia

Schedule

6:30-7:00pm - Doors Open, Arrive

7:00-7:55pm - Interview

7:55-8:30pm - Q&A

8:30-9:00pm - Networking

More About Leslie G. Schultz

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/T5zGVWlaS6yxGQ6-KM57coFgjYfenvvxTwy2qvPP-MHEVG9Xd6jqu3P0WXtxbngJO51oV3bn5Pjud6jFVxGLK6GnUOh4dX_tuA8fIc88Qj4JOTwjO7D6h4SRcSr3hQtxNg=s1600

Executive Director of BRIC since 2005 and President since 2012, Leslie G. Schultz—named Brooklyn Magazine’s “100 Most Influential people in Brooklyn culture”—leads a 100+member staff dedicated to supporting the creative process and enhancing access to arts and media programs that are reflective of Brooklyn’s diverse communities. In 2013, BRIC opened their multidisciplinary arts and media center, BRIC Arts | Media House in Downtown Brooklyn. BRIC House is a 40,000 square foot facility that offers a public media center, a major contemporary art exhibition space, two performance spaces, a glass-walled TV studio, and artist work spaces.

Under Schultz’s direction, BRIC has developed and implemented a new strategic plan; significantly grown individual, corporate and government support and created its first endowment and artistic growth fund; rebranded; restructured community media programs; entered into long-term grant agreements to more than double available funding for community media programs; launched a new performing arts residency program and expanded existing performing arts programs; and internally re-organized to develop synergies among programs that had previously functioned largely independently, all in preparation for their new home for the arts in Brooklyn.

Prior to BRIC, Schultz was a partner at the law firm Manatt Phelps & Phillips and its predecessor firm, focusing on capital projects for a range of non-profits and on non-profit governance/corporate affairs. Schultz is on the Board of Directors of the Downtown Brooklyn Partnership, is a founder and is on the Steering Committee of the Downtown Brooklyn Arts Alliance, and is a summa cum laude graduate of Brandeis University and a cum laude graduate of Harvard Law School.

More About Marcos Salazar 

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/eMdMTRF-MhOwCnKG8ykmpAxdcIooEV9p_K48Yfmwl2f9u9bjW22kp7CXkvZ_ag1XsBAXHEq6MitZqgsnn-fcgSOoif4atuMubLiOpbCnYFv4oo1q4AS06E3yWAPKmQ-0a2Q=s1600

Marcos Salazar (@marcossalazar) is a social entrepreneur, career + life coach, consultant, speaker, and community builder. His passion is working with professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives to help them pursue work they are passionate about, build authentic personal brands, become financially successful, and create lives that make the world a better place. He does this through 1-on-1 coaching, nonprofit and businesses consulting, and on a larger scale as Co-founder + Executive Director of Be Social Change where he’s built the largest social impact community and professional development hub in New York City. Marcos earned a B.A. in Psychology from Amherst College as well as a Masters in Organizational Management and an Executive Leadership Coaching certificate from The George Washington University. Marcos is a board member of the Young Professionals Nonprofit Network and an American Express Leadership Academy Fellow. You can learn more about him at www.MarcosSalazar.com.  

Event Organizers 

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/7aPLuKNr8OlzjXKEuwml0xNkEWsb0x47LCnFzyaGLfXCdSEEjPUOmBHGK3cSR1dIWAIDnmhaQzuK1bLEFG-N3ql0cvnwgiSWIJzgYkjqtmkgo91af6b6cU2uhb6ci1gy=s1600

Be Social Change is New York's largest social impact community with a mission to educate and connect the next generation of purpose-driven professionals, entrepreneurs, and creatives. Through professional development, capacity building education, community-building, and resource sharing, we empower people from all sectors and industries to pursue work they are passionate about and create lives that make the world a better place. Learn more at www.besocialchange.com.

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/sOgRRLee44_QZI3ZL_FZoAnY6XPZG8G8NTJnXH-8_Ho5eK8cV0PEwOxZRnI9WEZ3ZD0Zp3Sr9MR4TUXF5wWeHV3Trnmzqrea50g_5NB3ntgcBr3zIj4BtOBw4EmkPRG-0I0=s1600

BRIC (@BRICartsmedia) is the leading presenter of free cultural programming in Brooklyn, and one of the largest in New York City. We present and incubate work by artists and media-makers who reflect the diversity that surrounds us. BRIC programs reach hundreds of thousands of people each year. Learn more at www.bricartsmedia.org.

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/igda-nyc-winter-town-hall-tickets-20472157775

***

In 2015, we ran several great roundtables about different aspects of game development, and we ran our first Career Fair. We're even more excited for all of our 2016 events!


It's been six months since we rebooted the IGDA NYC chapter, and we'd like to invite you to join us for our second Town Hall as we recap what we've done so far and look forward to the year ahead.


The Town Hall meetings are an opportunity to come together to share ideas and discuss the plans and future direction of the chapter. Have feedback to share, ideas for future events, something you'd like to see the chapter accomplish, or something we can do better? This is your chance to join the discussion and be heard!


Space is limited. Please RSVP to secure your spot!

results.description:
Hey Everyone!

Better Off Bowling is kicking off a new season on Sunday afternoons this Winter and I thought I'd create an event for our group since there was a lot of interest previously! We played last season and it was a blast! Just to be clear, you have to register/pay through the leagues website in order to be a part of the league, not just RSVP here! :)

They've given us an amazing discount for the season! To get $10 off the regular registration price use code NYCMUWIN16 . I've already created a team for our group called Livin' on a Spare - here's the link: https://www.betteroffbowling.com/teams/6198-Livin--On-A-Spare

and you can get info on the season here: http://www.Betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg

Also, there are some other group members who are making their own teams with friends, so feel free to do that as well. It doesn't matter if you're a horrible bowler or a great one as this league is mainly about fun and meeting people, so that's right up our alley! PLUS! If Sundays don’t work for you there is a Tuesday night option as well! We have a team with the same name in that league you can join! 


This is the info on the meetup below! We get $10 off with the promo code, but the meetup ends soon!!

Better Off Bowling, New York‘s Biggest Social Bowling League! 

Hundreds of fun young professionals (20's and 30's), co-ed and non-competitive, and at only $79 (with discount code) for the entire season, incredibly affordable!

Includes:

- 6 weeks of coed social bowling (1-3 games each week) at Frames Bowling Lounge!

- Bowling on Sunday Afternoons: Jan 17, Jan 24, Jan 31, Feb 14, Feb 21, Feb 28
OR Tuesday Nights: Jan 26, Feb 2, Feb 9, Feb 16, Feb 23, Mar 1

- Hundreds of fun bowlers with an awesome after-bowling bar scene!

- Bowling shoe rentals and league Management

- Drink specials, after-bowling bar, and Happy Hours!

http://www.Betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg

Get $10 off with promo code: NYCMUWIN16

Join as a team, small group, or individual!

Check out our bowling pics: Bowling Pics!!

Register While Spots Last!

<a href="http://www.betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg"></a>

-----------------------------------------------

The league is filling up, so sign up soon!!

Email any questions or issues to: [masked]

results.description:
FANTASTIC FICTION at KGB reading series, hosts Ellen Datlow and Matthew Kressel present:

The Freedom Maze by Delia Sherman
Delia Sherman
Delia Sherman’s writing habit has been the cause of numerous short stories and novels, the most recent of which is the Norton Award-winning The Freedom Maze. Her next middle grade novel, The Evil Wizard Smallbone, will be published by Candlewick Press in November 2016. Her novella “The Great Detective” will be coming out from Tor.com early next year. She is also working on the Serial Box serial Fierce Artifice about the women of the court of Charles II of England. Her library and her art reside in New York full-time, but everything else important in her life is fully portable, including her indefatigable wife and sometime writing partner Ellen Kushner.

&

Last Song Before Night by Ilana C. Myer
Ilana C. Myer
Ilana C. Myer is the author of Last Song Before Night, an epic fantasy about poets and dark enchantments. Her writing has appeared in The Globe and Mail, the Los Angeles Review of Books, Salon, and the Huffington Post. Previously she was a journalist in Jerusalem. She lives in New York City.

Wednesday, January 20th, 2016, 7pm at

KGB Bar, 85 East 4th Street (just off 2nd Ave, upstairs.)
http://www.kgbfantasticfiction.org/

Subscribe to our mailing list:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/kgbfantasticfiction/

Readings are always free.

Please forward to friends at your own discretion.
results.name: Fantastic Fiction at KGB

results.description:
Come meet other Porsche lovers in a relaxed atmosphere in New York City.

Join us for a drink or dinner and enjoy great company.

 

A few of our favorite places so far have been:

Merchant River House in Battery Park City

It's right on the water between Liberty and Albany Street. Subways: N or R to Cortland Street and walk west on Albany Street, Wall Street 4 or 5 and then also make your way west across the Westside Highway.

SouthWestNY, also in Battery Park City

on the corner of Albany Street and South End Avenue

Another hot tip from our member and friend Andew Emmet.

WATERSTONE  GRILL On Stone street in lower Manhattan.

There is free parking on the street after 7PM so if you arrive by car and on time you are almost guaranteed a spot. Also subway is easy as many stops are nearby. We usually have the corner table in the window facing Stone Street where it is less noisy than in the bar area.

ZUM SCHNEIDER, In the East Village

Serves up authentic German fare, great beer and fabulous atmosphere. PROST!

results.description:
Hey Everyone!

Better Off Bowling is kicking off a new season on Sunday afternoons this Winter and I thought I'd create an event for our group since there was a lot of interest previously! We played last season and it was a blast! Just to be clear, you have to register/pay through the leagues website in order to be a part of the league, not just RSVP here! :)

They've given us an amazing discount for the season! To get $10 off the regular registration price use code NYCMUWIN16 . I've already created a team for our group called Spare Me - here's the link: https://www.betteroffbowling.com/teams/6189-Spare-Me

and you can get info on the season here: http://www.Betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg

Also, there are some other group members who are making their own teams with friends, so feel free to do that as well. It doesn't matter if you're a horrible bowler or a great one as this league is mainly about fun and meeting people, so that's right up our alley! PLUS! If Sundays don’t work for you there is a Tuesday night option as well! We have a team with the same name in that league you can join! 


This is the info on the meetup below! We get $10 off with the promo code, but the meetup ends soon!!

Better Off Bowling, New York‘s Biggest Social Bowling League! 

Hundreds of fun young professionals (20's and 30's), co-ed and non-competitive, and at only $79 (with discount code) for the entire season, incredibly affordable!

Includes:

- 6 weeks of coed social bowling (1-3 games each week) at Frames Bowling Lounge!

- Bowling on Sunday Afternoons: Jan 17, Jan 24, Jan 31, Feb 14, Feb 21, Feb 28
OR Tuesday Nights: Jan 26, Feb 2, Feb 9, Feb 16, Feb 23, Mar 1

- Hundreds of fun bowlers with an awesome after-bowling bar scene!

- Bowling shoe rentals and league Management

- Drink specials, after-bowling bar, and Happy Hours!

http://www.Betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg

Get $10 off with promo code: NYCMUWIN16

Join as a team, small group, or individual!

Check out our bowling pics: Bowling Pics!!

Register While Spots Last!

<a href="http://www.betteroffbowling.com/newyork/reg"></a>

-----------------------------------------------

The league is filling up, so sign up soon!!

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
Successful dating relationships and marriages don’t come easy, but we are convinced that they ARE within reach. Gather for an exciting evening of food and refreshments, new friends, fun and honest discussion from a faith-based perspective, and a ultra-transparent lecture. We will discover many of the following relationship strategies, including:

The Non-Negotiable Things to Work Through During Your Engagement
Working Through Baggage from Previous Relationships
The 4 Personality Types & How Yours Will Effect Your Marriage (w/ Personality Test)
The 5 Love Languages (w/ Love Language Test)
Your Familial Upbringing & Its Effect on Your Marital Expectations
Healthy Communication Strategies & Conflict Management
Big Forgiveness & Its Contribution to Relational Longevity
Love vs. Emotion vs. Lust
Teamwork & Clarifying Roles & Responsibilities
The Concept of Unconditional Love
Trust & Faithfulness: the Foundation for Sexual Intimacy
Whether you’re already MARRIED or are SINGLE and thinking about tying the knot at some point in the future, leave this event feeling more equipped to create a marriage that lasts. Invite your significant other and/or friends to join you!

AFTER PARTY
After the workshop, all are welcome to hang out and network with friends and enjoy the music and refreshments.

DETAILS

Dates: January 13, 20, & 27 (Each week will be on different topics)
Cost: Free
Bring: Two or three friends & a small food/dessert item to pass
results.name: Dating & Marriage Workshop (3 part series!)

results.description:
OK, we're on for interval training tomorrow. We'll be running some self-paced sprints in order to improve our speed and conditioning. You don't have to be a running pro to do this! Everyone sets their own goal and their own pace.

Details: We’ll start out at the parking lot by the tennis courts at Masters School (see map here: https://goo.gl/maps/HnLymU7LSrr). After a warm up jog around the campus, we'll run some timed laps on the track.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. In warm weather I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: Masters School (9 Clinton Ave, Dobbs Ferry, NY 10522)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Interval Training

$28 for 2 tickets (use discount code "2" at checkout)    

Multiple Meetup groups co-organizing so don't just go by the RSVPs you see here. Up to 50 members attending. 21 & older. 

*RSVPing alone will not get you into this event. You must also purchase a ticket in advance (NO tix will be sold at door). 

*Get tickets at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/boardgame/dates/Jan-20-2016_at_0700PM

results.description:
7 pm Pre-Intermediate Level with Sophie Cazeneuve

For students who have completed the Beginner Level or possess a good understanding of the basic patterns as well as, the principles of timing and partnering. Emphasis will be on the continuing development of partnering skills, lead and follow, dance floor etiquette, a good understanding of timing, and the ability to execute simple sequences. New steps and turn patterns will be introduced and linked together to develop new combinations.


8pm Beginner Level with Julien Bec

introductory course, which gives a foundation of movement for students who have had little or no dance experience. Emphasis will be on the development of partnering skills, lead and follow, the basic principles of timing, as well as basic foot work and basic patterns.

We suggest between 3 months in Beginner Level before you move on to the next Level.

8pm Intermediate Level with Sophie Cazeneuve

Description coming soon

Drop in $25, or $100 for the month ( 4 classes, 1 per week )

results.description:
Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://nyurban.com/open-play-basketball/

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.
results.how_to_find_us: West Side High School - 102 St between Amsterdam & Columbus
results.name: Basketball Open Play- WSH Wednesday A-B

results.description:
THIS IS OUR SECOND ANNUAL LAW OF ATTRACTION NETWORKING EVENT!

THIS WAS A GREAT SUCCESS LAST YEAR AND WAS ALOT OF FUN, AS WELL AS INFORMATIVE FOR ALL OF US. FIND OUT WHAT YOUR FELLOW LOA PRACTITIONERS DO FOR A LIVING


YOU WILL HAVE 30 SECONDS TO TELL US WHAT YOUR OCCUPATION IS ABOUT AND YOU WILL BE TIMED! AFTER YOUR PRESENTATION, YOU WILL HAVE 2 MINUTES TO ANSWER ANY QUESTION FROM THE GROUP.

results.description:
Though we often regard love and compassion as limited qualities, of which we hardly have enough to extend to ourselves and our families, these states can be developed and expanded with practice and effort. In fact, each of us has a boundless capacity for kindness and understanding, which we can apply to all of our relationships -- to ourselves, our family and friends, people we don’t know, and even those we don’t like. 

Creating a Compassionate World is a six-week class which combines western psychological techniques with traditional lovingkindness meditation to develop our limitless capacity for beneficial and wise action.


Though prior meditation experience is not required, experience with metta/lovingkindness meditation may be helpful. Chairs will be provided. Note we are located on the second floor of a walk-up building.  There is no elevator.


Details and registration: http://theidproject.org/events/2016/01/06/creating-compassionate-world-nyc-online
