results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

results.description:
Full title: Managing Uncertainty, Mitigating Risk - Tackling the Unknown in Financial Risk Assessment and Decision Making (book available on Palgrave Macmillan and Nick will be signing copies at the event too!)

Abstract: Financial risk management started in a period when academic finance was wedded to probability. Risk and its transferability was the focus and uncertainty was sidelined. After the recent financial crisis, uncertainty and its consequences have become a major concern for many prominent academics, yet practitioners are constrained by probability-based tools and regulatory mandates. Managing Uncertainty, Mitigating Risk offers a liberated perspective on uncertainty in banking and finance. The book stresses that uncertainty must be confronted by using a broader range of inputs, employing methods outside conventional probability. More often than not, systemic risks are not completely unforeseeable and a range of likely risk scenarios can be fleshed out, quantified and largely mitigated. We can accomplish this only if we widen our knowledgebase to include qualitative data and judgment. Probability and historical data alone cannot sufficiently model game-changing and catastrophic one-off situations such as Eurozone exit and breakup, US debt ceiling, and Brexit.

This book presents a robust foundation and a novel and practical method for incorporating uncertainty into existing risk frameworks. It takes the reader beyond the realms of probability in modern finance, into imprecise probability – the mathematics of uncertainty. We introduce uncertain value-at-risk (UVaR), a measure which takes the VaR engine and enhances it using credal nets, an imprecise extension of Bayesian nets. Unlike the unjustified precision of probability-based models, UVaR helps to assesses uncertainty by incorporating expert insight through priors, with more extensive datasets. By combining a solid quantitative method with an implementation framework and cases, this book allows the reader to not only understand the solution for managing uncertain one-offs, but also to see the end-product. This is a starting point for risk practitioners to go beyond regulatory-initiated tools in order to employ their own approaches towards recognizing and managing uncertainty. 

Speaker: Nick Firoozye is a Managing Director at Nomura International and heads a global team in cross-product derivatives research. He has many years of experience in a variety of research and trading roles in both buy-side and sell-side firms including Goldman Sachs, Deutsche Bank, Citadel, Sanford Bernstein and Lehman Brothers. Known for his work in Quantitative Strategy, Nick's area of expertise ranges from asset allocation models and macro-financial forecasting to systematic and RV trading. Previously, he was Head of European Rates Strategy, and covered the Eurozone crisis, rescue packages and possible break-up, working closely with the risk management and legal teams. Dr Firoozye was an Assistant Professor at the University of Illinois, and holds a PhD in Applied Mathematics from Courant Institute, New York University. He speaks and writes frequently on financial markets and economics issues. His team was recently awarded Global Capital's Derivatives Research House of 2015, and he was co-author of one of five papers shortlisted for the 2012 Wolfson Economics Prize on the breakup of the Eurozone.
results.name: Seminar (London) - Nick Firoozye - Managing Uncertainty, Mitigating Risk

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

Hey folks, let's get some good booze, play some bocci, and hear some good music at Union Hall in Park Slope!  This is an awesome and HUGE bar, with lots of couches,  lots of books, and even two bocci courts and a downstairs music space!!!

http://www.unionhallny.com/

We'll meet up starting around 7:30 so we can get on the bocci schedule incase anyone wants to play.

As for bocce rules, I think we should follow the simple rules shown in this video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v3slD-qDIW8&list=FLktf6mvAXyJNUBDGYD69zbg&index=2

Union Hall is a block east from the Union St. train station for the R train.

See you guys there!!!!!

Bocce Rules:

Goal of game= to get as many balls close to the palina (white ball)

1. Throw palina down at least ½ length of court.

2. Team one throws all their balls as close to palina as possible, but ball hitting wall doesn’t count. Or, Teams take turns throwing their balls.

3. Once all balls are thrown, closest color balls get points until next closest ball is a different color, and that stops point count for that round.

4. You can also try to hit palina closer to your balls, after putting all your color balls in a group on the court.

5. Balls that hit the wall on first throw are taken out of the court.

(event is co-hosted with the Everything Brooklyn Meetup group)

http://www.meetup.com/everythingbrooklyn/

I have found a new location and I think it is the best yet! Please come out to our trial run Wednesday January 20th at the Well in East Williamsburg from 7:30-10pm!

If everything works out I will be able to host Drink & Draw at this location every other Wednesday at the same time. Please come check it out. The Well is a cool spot that you might not know is there. They have like 60 beers on tap, and a separate room with a little stage, lights, and tables which are set up perfect for drawing. If you've never been to one of my Drink & Draw nights, it is a very fun, casual life drawing series with awesome, diverse models. The Well doesn't have a budget for this event yet, so I ask that everyone who comes to draw is prepared to give a $10 donation for the model so we can keep it going (if you are short on funds and still want to come, we will not turn you away! Please come, one and all) As always, I will provide some drawing materials, but please bring your own for added creative bonus. I hope to see you there!

P.S. This first Drink & Draw night also happens to be my birthday. Say hi!

Vinyasa and Core Strength Yoga are taught in fusion. Breathing techniques are taught in sequence with posture names, positioning, parts of the body that benefit (adverse muscle groups, organs and nervous system) and the Chakras that will be balanced in association.
Extra 15 minute meditation practice given after class during Savasana (final relaxation) for those interested in a deeper practice. Bringing greater spirituality, grounding and peace of mind. 

Discount for those 65 years or over or on Medicare. 

This is a wheel chair excessible facility.

Free Parking. 

$12 a lesson.

$10 for seniors.

Every Wednesday Night at 7:30pm. (Rsvp required)

Topics to study:


- Introduction to Gnosis: The term "Gnosis" & it's foundations; Science, Philosophy, Art and Mysticism.

- Foundations of Gnostic Psychology: The Consciousness, The Personality & the Ego. The Human Machine & the 3 Brains. The human mind & the Universal Mind.

- The Awakening of the Consciousness: Mindfulness, Self-observation & The fourth dimension. Lucid Dreams & The Astral World.

- Universal Laws and the Ray of Death: Return, Recurrence, and Reincarnation. Law of Karma and Dharma. The Mysteries of Life and Death. Evolution, Involution, and Revolution.

results.description:
How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? 

Our TurnON events offer an opportunity to connect with people in a whole new way. Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

We play 3 communication games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you) where you get the opportunity to examine yourself through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.


This event is hosted by OneTaste NYC, an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: Real People, Real Connection: Intimacy & Communication Games

results.description:
Week #2 of our current Beginner Salsa class Cycle is around the corner. Note that the time for this Wednedays is 8-9:10pm. It is not 7:30 like last week. And the room is 403.

A better/alternate way to keep up with updates, room changes, tips, videos, and in contact with other students is to join the facebook group:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/


Location: Pearl Studios, 500 Eighth Avenue New York, NY 10018

Room: 403, 4th Floor

Fee: $15 per class

Time: from 8pm-9:30pm. In week 1 we had a good number of people who had never danced salsa before and they were able to learn everything I taught. We will review the basics again so if you missed the first week you can come this week and have zero issues catching up. After reviewing, we will focus on learning the right and left turns. We will demystify turns and learn the proper foot placement, spotting, balance, timing, and so on. Also, we will create a routine that that we will use to practice. Let the sweating begin :D

Here is a partial preview tentative syllabus for the first 6 weeks out of the 12:

During each week, the following concepts will be taught along with the material when necessary:

(Posture) (Weight Shifting) (hand rotation) (spotting) (pacing) (balance) (distance control) (musicality) (timing) (body coordination) (body isolations) (etc)

Week 1 (Jan 13th)

Footwork: Basic Step, Basic variations, upper body movement, Body isolations and coordination exercises, Timing, Music

Partnerwork: Open Hold, Close Hold, Hand placements, Correct Frame, Correct Tension

Week 2 (Jan 20th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Right-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Leading The right-turn, Following the right-turn

Week 3 (Jan 27th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Left-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Cross-Body-Lead and Follow.

Week 4 (Feb 3rd)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 1 and 2 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Cross-body-Lead combined with Inside Turn, Turn Combinations

Week 5 (Feb 10th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 3 and 4 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Open-Break Step

Week 6 (Feb 17th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 5 and 6 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Walk-Around Turn
results.name: Progressive Beginner Salsa Dancing Class (Wed 20th)

results.description:
Week #2 of our current Beginner Salsa class Cycle is around the corner. Note that the time for this Wednedays is 8-9:10pm. It is not 7:30 like last week. And the room is 403.

A better/alternate way to keep up with updates, room changes, tips, videos, and in contact with other students is to join the facebook group:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

Location: Pearl Studios, 500 Eighth Avenue New York, NY 10018

Room: 403, 4th Floor

Time: from 8pm-9:30pm. 

Fee: $15 per class


In week 1 we had a good number of people who had never danced salsa before and they were able to learn everything I taught.We will review the basics again so if you missed the first week you can come this week and have zero issues catching up. After reviewing, we will focus on learning the right and left turns. We will demystify turns and learn the proper foot placement, spotting, balance, timing, and so on. Also, we will create a routine that that we will use to practice. Let the sweating begin :D

Here is a partial preview tentative syllabus for the first 6 weeks out of the 12:

During each week, the following concepts will be taught along with the material when necessary:

(Posture) (Weight Shifting) (hand rotation) (spotting) (pacing) (balance) (distance control) (musicality) (timing) (body coordination) (body isolations) (etc)

Week 1 (Jan 13th)

Footwork: Basic Step, Basic variations, upper body movement, Body isolations and coordination exercises, Timing, Music

Partnerwork: Open Hold, Close Hold, Hand placements, Correct Frame, Correct Tension

Week 2 (Jan 20th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Right-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Leading The right-turn, Following the right-turn

Week 3 (Jan 27th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Left-Turn

Partnerwork: Previous class review, Cross-Body-Lead and Follow.

Week 4 (Feb 3rd)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 1 and 2 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review, Cross-body-Lead combined with Inside Turn, Turn Combinations

Week 5 (Feb 10th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 3 and 4 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review,  Open-Break Step

Week 6 (Feb 17th)

Footwork: Previous class review, Shine 5 and 6 (Footwork variations)

Partner-work: Previous class review,  Walk-Around Turn

#BFunklessBreak is coming to an end very soon! Yay!!  What better way to start 2016 than dancing and exercising the bollywood way via Naach Xpress. Our first Naach Xpress class is in NYC on 20th January. 

What is Naach Xpress? NAACH XPRESS is high-energy, fitness fueled dance class to Bollywood beats. It's one big dance PARTY! Students sweat it out to the best of Bollywood Funk NYC's signature dance moves. With a mix of jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and other well known dance techniques, we bring to you our fast track class to sweating it out with some style. Make some friends and dance the night away in this amazing class! There are no worries, come to class tension free and get your weekly dose of fitness and cardio! Each class will focus on ONE hot and popular Bollywood dance song. With a new song featured every week. ALL levels are welcome! Not a dancer? DON'T YOU WORRY! This class is for all, anyone can do it!

Looking forward to seeing you all there!!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.

results.description:
How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? Our TurnON events offer an opportunity to connect with people in a whole new way. Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

We play 3 communication games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you) where you get the opportunity to examine yourself through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City. This event is hosted by OneTaste NYC, an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8-10pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Wednesday Improv Scenework Class 8-10pm ($10)

venue.name: Introductory Citizens' Climate Lobby Conference Call

results.description:
Be part of the team!  You CAN make a difference in the world. 

Our strategy is simple, the outcome is huge. 
Empower individuals so that they experience significant growth of their own political and personal power, as well as discover and celebrate their own capacity to make a significant difference in this world. Our volunteers break down partisan and ideological barriers by reaching out to key stakeholders to build positive, effective working relationships.

Learn how you can generate the political will for a stable climate. 
View this short video: https://youtu.be/9oyguP4nLv0

What Others Are Saying

"With all the negative news on climate and Congress it's understandable to feel discouraged.  But hopelessness is not a strategy for making a difference and neither is acting alone.  Citizens' Climate Lobby is the antidote, the missing link, the Harvard of citizen activism." ---

Sam Daley-Harris Founder, RESULTS, Microcredit Summit Campaign, and the Center for Citizen Empowerment and Transformation

"Most impressive is the work of Citizens' Climate Lobby...If you want to join the fight to save the planet, to save creation for your grandchildren, there is no more effective step you could take than becoming an active member of this group." ---

Dr. James Hansen Climate scientist and former head of the NASA Goddard Institute

"The Citizens' Climate Lobby has identified the issue of pricing carbon as a vitally important lever in promoting dialog and action on climate protection. If you've been looking for that one group to join, you can stop looking now." ---

Dr. Daniel Kammen Professor - University of California, Berkeley

To learn more about Citizens' Climate Lobby visit us online at:

www.citizensclimatelobby.org

and also register for a Wednesday night (8 PM ET)

one hour introductory conference call.

VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: Don't let a very-low RSVP sign up number on the Meet-Up site discourage you from attending. The call is advertised in other places nation-wide. People who are already members attend local meetings and may not RSVP to the meetings listed on meetup.
results.name: Learn how you can generate the political will for a stable climate.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street


East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

This six week, progressive session: Jan 20, 2016 - Feb 24th
Wednesdays
8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6


  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

  Register and pricing below:

 http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/PersonifyEBusiness/Default.aspx?TabID=416&pid=643450740


Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

Have you been searching for a mentor/training to get your real estate investing career started? 

This wednesday I want to introduce you to the same real estate investing college like learning system that has helped me to start my career. Thanks to what I have learned I have part ownership of 59 units, have completed over $2Mil in real estate transactions part time and now I have the time freedom to run my business from home as a real estate agent / investor.

results.description:
Even people without HAM radio licenses can talk on the air if someone is acting as their "control operator". At the next meeting, let's see how many people we can get to talk on the air.

At the last Meeting: Ariella, Ephram and Rich were looking at a BaoFeng HAM radio and learning how to program it with "chirp" software.


James was testing the software that converts step and direction signals to DC servo motor outputs, running it on an arduino and using it to spin a 3D printed "thing" w/ a tiny DC motor.

Ephram passed his HAM radio exam at HRU (after only one day of studying?) and showed off his custom built temperature monitor, used for barbeque cooking competitions.

Jim recently got an ardupilot/arducopter flight controller board , was working w/ "cloud-ide" for web-based arduino development and has been working on 3D printed quad-copter motor mounts.

Ariella found an interest in DX'ing (at HRU) and visited a Nassau County ARES meeting so maybe she'll get involved in disaster communications too.


Jesse has people trying to buy clover leaf antennas from him even though he hasn't been able to find anyone to explain how his antenna works and hasn't figured out how to test them properly. (w/ an "SWR" test at 5.8Ghz)

We talked a little bit about Baluns, antenna polarization and patterns.

I'm hoping Jesse can get some of his questions answered on Tech-net this Sunday.
results.name: Make a contact w/ the LIMARC radio repeater.

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 6:00AM.  Don't be late.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group

We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Attorney

• Mortgage Broker

• Realtor

• Electrician

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

PLEASE TEXT rsvp[masked] - Cathy

HIIT, as the name suggests, combines high-intensity, calorie-torching periods of activity with low-intensity recovery periods for an overall duration of as little as 10 minutes each session. Some studies have shown that HIIT burns up to nine times more fat than traditional cardiovascular exercise and keeps your metabolism elevated for more than 24 hours afterwards. This means you are going to keep burning calories long after you have finished exercising.

Boot Camp Workout. This intense circuit keeps your heart rate up, burns calories, and tones your whole body. With these circuits we will use body weight exercises alternating with calisthenics.

results.description:
All Of Our 'Bagels and Business' Events Sell Out.  Register Early to Reserve Your Spot. 

Check Below to See if Your Professional Category is Available.  Please DO NOT Register

Consider this morning 'An Experience,' and Not 'An Event.' 

******************************************************

**THE FOLLOWING PROFESSIONS ARE SOLD OUT**- Please DO NOT Register if Your Professional Category Can Be Found Below:

• Life and Disability 

• Residential Real Estate


• Interfaith Minister


• Professional Organizer


• Life Coach


• Copywriting


• Matchmaker


• Energy Healing


• Personal Trainer


• Ball Room Dancing


• Financial Advising


• Business Coaching


• Bookkeeper


*******************************************************

Join Us at at 'Bagels and Business'

A Fun, Productive, Facilitated Morning Business Networking Event

Imagine beginning your day with up to 20 brand new connections...any of which can turn into your next client, strategic partner or just the resource you've been looking for.

This event will have a mix of unstructured and facilitated networking/intros...the best of both worlds!

******************************************************* 

Here's How It Works:

• Only one person per professional category will be allowed

• Each attendee's profession will be represented at the event

• Connecting to Greatness Founder, Kate Gaffin will facilitate the meeting format

• You may only represent one profession at this event.

• Each attendee will be able to let the group know who they are looking to meet.

Please note that what your actual breakfast cost is additional and is simply whatever you order...plus tax and gratuity. 

*******************************************************

'Bagels and Business' Agenda:

8:00 AM to 8:30 - Check In/Informal Networking

8:30 AM to 9:30 AM - Facilitated Attendee Intros/Perfect Referral Asks

9:00 to 9:45 AM -Continued Informal Networking

Starbucks Dark Roast, Bagels and Muffins Will Be Served

*******************************************************


We'll be meeting in a lovely Breather space in the Flatiron District


For CTG Members, Click Below to Receive a Free Hour at Breather plus a 20% discount on all future bookings:

brt.hr/greatness

Beautiful, practical spaces whenever you need them.

Sorry for the hassle. This is a one-time request: http://bit.ly/CerealEntrepreneurs

We are an invite-only group of CEOs/founders of small tech startups. We also have a dedicated group of VCs and Angels who participate in our events. The Breakfasts are a safe space, if you will, for CEOs to discuss issues they are facing, as well as success stories, and to problem-solve while helping one another. A lot of great things have happened as a result of the breakfasts -- business connections, funding intros, new hires, etc.

REGISTER HERE to join our Breakfast group: 


http://bit.ly/CerealEntrepreneurs

Please ask before bringing a guest.

results.description:
Happy New Year Coaches! And a warm welcome to all the new members. 

 
Please join us for our 2016 kick-off meeting. Enjoy the company of other coaches, have some coffee and light light morning nourishment. After introductions, I'll be sharing some of the ways I doubled my coaching success in 2015, and I invite others to do the same. If time allows, I'll also show you a really great technique to help your clients move forward-- it might really blow you AND your clients away!

Space is limited to 12-15 members. Please respond as soon as you can--if there are more responses I'll get us a bigger room.

We'll start our meeting at 9am sharp, but feel free to get there a little early. On January 19th (Tuesday) I'll send more details. 

I'm looking forward to seeing you and to a super fantastic 2016! Oh, please feel free to dress casually and comfortably.
results.name: Coaching Forward: Success Planning for 2016

results.description:
Important! This event requires registration on our website. Sign-up here. 

WHY A BOOTCAMP?

We wanted to offer a fast, easy way for people to get introduced to the tools and techniques of Design Thinking. The Design Thinking process is not a monolithic process that has to be brought in as massive expense, trouble and stress. It’s a toolbox of skills and mindsets that we believe anyone can learn, and start to bring into their jobs in many simple ways.

WHAT IS DESIGN THINKING ANYWAY?

Design Thinking is a process for solving problems and developing business strategy that puts an increased emphasis on understanding internal and external stakeholders. In this process we emphasize human stories, real world observations, and a deeper level of empathy.

The process we teach is not fundamentally different than any design thinking process you will find anywhere else….we’ve just tried to make it simple to use. We took a look at every other process we saw being taught and consulted with and boiled down to the simplest language possible. We work hard not to overcomplicate the process – it’s a tool to be adapted and molded to an individual’s situation. Design Thinking serves as a valuable common language that diverse teams and groups of people can use to effectively collaborate on challenges and projects.

WHAT WILL I LEARN?

We’ll cover the five phases of design thinking, giving you a background into the theory and practice of each. We’ll move through each phase quickly and fuidly, stopping after each phase to reflect and take a breather. It’s a long, hard and fun day…we’ll push you to absorb a lot of material, but you’ll leave with a solid toolset and a great start on your journey through design thinking.
results.name: Design Thinking Bootcamp

results.name: Embrace the Rhythms of Rest

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
